Some of the working group members are also deciding whether to accept or reject them. Feel free to explore, these NEPs will aid you during your development as you integrate them with your dApps. Share your thoughts and leave a comment.\\\\n\\\\n- [NEP-330: Build details extension](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/533) - Contract standards Update \\\\n- [NEP-536: Reduce the number of refund receipts](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/536) - Protocol Update\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nTo learn more about NEP\\\\\\'s click \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0001.md) \\\\nTo view all the NEP\\\\\\'s click \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/orgs/near/projects/51/views/1)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### ETHDam \\\\u{1f3c6}\\\\n\\\\nAt the ETHDam Hackathon, you can engage with NEAR\\\\\\'s ecosystem through various avenues. Joining the event\\\\\\'s chat allows for networking ([ETHDam Hackathon chat](https://t.me/+l1hv9RxZCCVkNzA0)), while Owen offers on-site support. NEAR\\\\\\'s bounty program provides lucrative opportunities, including the [Chain Signatures](https://linktr.ee/chainsignatures) bounty offering $3,000 in USDC for innovative use cases of the Chain Signatures API, and the \\\\\\\"Power your startup with NEAR\\\\\\\" bounty, also with a $3,000 prize, for integrating startups with NEAR\\\\\\'s technology stack. \\\\n\\\\nCriteria for submissions and judging prioritize creativity, quality, and technical excellence, with resources like [NEAR Components](https://docs.near.org/build/near-components/what-is) and [NEAR testnet faucets](https://near-faucet.io/) available for support. By engaging with NEAR, developers can explore cutting-edge technologies and compete for substantial prizes at the hackathon.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### HACKS OF THE WEEK \\\\u{1f468}\\\\u{200d}\\\\u{1f4bb}\\\\u{1f3c6}\\\\n\\\\n- Check out the RPC Selector browser extension for NEAR, allowing you to customize RPC endpoints for dapps and wallets: [GitHub - RPC Selector](https://github.com/Sliman4/rpc-selector)\\\\n\\\\n**Building something on NEAR?** Share your project with the community! Tell us about it in the documentation community group, and get featured. Click \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://t.me/neardocscg).\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### STAKEWARS \\\\u{1f680}\\\\n**Participating in Stakewars? Here are some quick news and notes you should be aware of.**\\\\n\\\\n-  The community announced the temporary suspension of operations on StatelessNet due to challenges in meeting required standards. This decision aims to ensure a more stable experience for all participants.\\\\n\\\\n- The Stake Wars IV program concluded, with plans to potentially restart the program in the future. Participants were thanked for their participation in the event.\\\\n\\\\n-  As long as you are qualified for the reward program details we shared and followed the step to onboard with StatelessNet, you should get a reward.\\\\n\\\\n- The team plans to finalize reward distribution and send rewards by the end of this week. Rewards for validators will be sent to the owner ID of the staking pool contract on mainnet, as provided during registration.\\\\n\\\\n- When we resume StatelessNet, the network may start from a fresh state, requiring major updates. Keeping nodes up during this period may not be beneficial.\\\\n\\\\n- We\\\\\\'ll inform the community once we start accepting proposals for the traffic generation program again.\\\\n\\\\n- There\\\\\\'s a possibility of restarting the program later. We\\\\\\'ll keep you updated on any developments. Thank you all for participating in Stake Wars IV!\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### CHAIN ABSTRACTION COMMUNITY \\\\u{1f929}\\\\n\\\\nThe chain abstraction community has been actively engaged in discussions and developments aimed at enhancing interoperability and standardization across different blockchain networks.They have been exploring techniques like Multi-Party Computation (MPC) to address security and key management concerns. Discussions around key rotation within MPC systems have been gaining traction, as highlighted in recent community exchanges. As part of ongoing efforts to streamline development practices, there have been discussions on standardized deployment data storage practices, with community members advocating for transparent and accessible repositories of contract deployment information. \\\\n\\\\nCheck out this \\\\u{1f449} [GitHub repository](https://github.com/near/mpc-recovery) containing code for MPC contracts, illustrating the implementation of payload-based key management for chain signature requests and responses.\\\\n\\\\nFor further details, you can refer to the following links:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [Chain Signatures Documentation](https://docs.near.org/concepts/abstraction/chain-signatures)\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [NEAR Multichain Example](https://github.com/near-examples/near-multichain)\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [Chain Signatures Use Cases](https://docs.near.org/concepts/abstraction/signatures/use-cases)\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [FastAuth SDK Documentation](https://docs.near.org/tools/fastauth-sdk)\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [NEAR NFT Minting on Farcaster](https://warpcast.com/brower1/0xab61fd1b)\\\\n\\\\n[Learn more about the Chain Abstraction Community](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=chain-abstraction)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### CALL FOR CONTRIBUTORS \\\\u{1f4de}\\\\n\\\\n-  Ecosystem developers propose a devcontainer image for examples encompassing both Rust and Node tooling. Volunteers are welcomed to contribute to `near-devcontainers` and test the additional container on examples. [Join Tools Community](https://t.me/NEAR_Tools_Community_Group)\\\\n\\\\n- We\\\\\\'ve initiated alpha testing the BOS web engine for creating decentralized front end components on NEAR. Get involved today by following this [link](https://bwe-docs.near.dev/).\\\\n\\\\n- NEAR Horizon 2 Cohort invites developers like you to step into scaling decentralized applications. More details \\\\u{1f449}[here](https://twitter.com/nearhorizon/status/1768310840120189123).\\\\n\\\\n- With the upcoming SDK 5.1 release, there will be updates needed in transitioning from #[near_bindgen] to #[near]. Matias is working on documentation updates, but additional assistance may be required. Don\\\\\\'t hesitate to reach out if you can lend a hand! Reach out to [Docs community](https://t.me/neardocscg).\\\\n\\\\n- Given the release of the new SDK, both docs and example repositories need updating. If you want to contribute , [join the Docs Community Group](https://near.social/devgovgigs.near/widget/gigs-board.pages.community.activity?handle=documentation).\\\\n\\\\n- Check out [DevHub\\\\\\'s On-Chain Quests](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=challenges) \\\\u{26f3}\\\\u{fe0f}, where you\\\\\\'ll find a dynamic array of challenges across various communities, earning recognition and respect as you conquer each one! \\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n# UPCOMING EVENTS \\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### ONLINE:\\\\n- April 18, 2024 | Contract Standards WG Call #5 | [Add to your calendar](https://bit.ly/3UcYyfW)\\\\n-  April 17 | Documentation community call | [Add to your Calendar](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/r/eventedit/copy/NjhpcWZjN20yaGxvdnMzdjg2Mm45MGdtYWRfMjAyNDA0MTdUMTcwMDAwWiBjX2Y1NGVkMzdmZDkyMzI3YWNkYzdlNDM0M2ZlNDA3MjJhZTU3OTdiNmM4MjkyOWJhOTNlOWYzYTg5YzY5NjU3YWJAZw)\\\\n- Chain Abstraction Community Call | Coming soon \\\\n- Thursdays 5PM UTC | **DevHub Livestreams** | [Live on X](https://twitter.com/NEARDevHub) and [Twitch](https://twitch.tv/neardevhub)\\\\n\\\\n### ASIA:\\\\n\\\\n- March 26, 2024 - March 27, 2024 | WOW Summit | Hong Kong \\\\n- March 27, 2024 - March 28, 2024  | [BUIDL Asia | Seoul, Korea](https://www.buidl.asia/) | KryptoSeoul \\\\u{1f449} NEAR Foundation and Korea Hub will be present at the event \\\\n- March 29, 2024 - March 31, 2024 | [ETH Seoul | Seoul, Korea](http://www.ethseoul.org/) | KryptoSeoul, Dystopia Labs \\\\u{1f449} DevHub and NEARWEEK will be present at the event \\\\n- April 6-9, 2024 | Hong Kong Web3 Festival 2024 | Hong Kong | HashKey and Wanxiang | BD to speak\\\\n\\\\n### MIDDLE EAST\\\\n- April 15-16, 2024 | [Blockchain Life 2024](https://blockchain-life.com/asia/en/spring2024/?utm_source=google&utm_medium=organic) | Dubai | Blockchain Life | NEAR Foundation, Arpit has a speaker slot\\\\n- April 18-19, 2024 | [Token 2049 Dubai](https://www.dubai.token2049.com/) | Dubai | | NEAR Foundation organizing booth. Illia, Chris speaking\\\\n- April 22-23, 2024 | World Blockchain Summit 2024 | Dubai | Trescon | NEAR Foundation, tentative speaker slot for Arpit\\\\n\\\\n### EUROPE\\\\n\\\\n- March 23, 2024 - March 24, 2024 | [Money Motion 2024](https://moneymotion.com/) | Zagreb, Croatia | Money Motion\\\\n- March 27, 2024 - March 30, 2024 | [ETH Bucharest | Bucharest, Romania](https://www.ethbucharest.xyz/) | ETH Bucharest \\\\u{1f449} DevHub will be present at the event \\\\n- March 18, 2024 - March 20, 2024 | [Digital Asset Summit](https://www.blockworks.co/) | London | Blockworks\\\\n- April 8-12, 2024 | [Paris Blockchain Week](https://www.parisblockchainweek.com/) | Paris, France | | NF leading; Chris D speaking\\\\nApril 12-14, 2024 | [ETHDam](https://www.ethdam.com/) | Amsterdam, Netherlands | ETHDam | DevHub\\\\n\\\\n### SOUTH AMERICA\\\\n\\\\n- March 22nd - March 24 | [ETHSamba](https://ethsamba.org/) | Brazil \\\\u{1f449} DevHub DevRels / NEAR Campus will be present at the event\\\\n\\\\n### THE UNITED STATES \\\\n\\\\n- March 20, 2024 - March 22, 2024 | IWB 2024 | DC area\\\\n- April 3-5, 2024 | [NFT.NYC](https://www.nft.nyc/) | New York, NY | NFT.NYC\\\\n- April | San Francisco | Funding the Commons (AI Focused Day) | FtheC | Banyan + EDGE\\\\n- April 18-19, 2024 | The Institutional Crypto Conference East | New York, NY \\\\n- April 29 - May 3, 2024 | [5th Annual International Tech Summit](https://www.internationaltechsummit.com/) | Hamilton, Bermuda | Penrose | \\\\\\\"Abhi V / Olga Chris D / Abhi speaking\\\\\\\"\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\nIf you are running a Local NEAR event please register as a Hackbox host [here](https://near.org/hackbox.near/widget/home). \\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n## CONSENSUS 2024\\\\nExciting opportunities await those interested in participating in the upcoming Consensus event. Choose from three ticket options tailored for the NEAR Ecosystem:\\\\n\\\\n- Hackathon Developer Pass: For active developers and open-source contributors committed to participating in-person at the EasyA Consensus Hackathon on May 29-31, A complimentary Developer Pass is offered to approved applicants until capacity is reached. Apply \\\\u{1f449}[here](https://consensus2024.coindesk.com/apply/developer-hackathon/-id/0).\\\\n\\\\n- Developer Pass: Special $109 rate available for active Web3 and Web2 developers. Apply before prices increase on March 15th [here](https://consensus2024.coindesk.com/apply/developer/-id/0). The Developer Pass grants access to all three days of Consensus on May 29-31.  \\\\n\\\\n- 15% off Pro Passes and Explorer Passes: Enjoy a 15% discount on Pro Passes and Explorer Passes using the code \\\\\\\"NEAR\\\\\\\" [here](https://consensus2024.coindesk.com/register?promo=NEAR).\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n## JOIN COMMUNITIES - TG CHANNELS \\\\n- [Protocol Community](https://t.me/NEAR_Protocol_Community_Group)\\\\n- [Stake-wars](https://t.me/near_stake_wars)\\\\n- [Tools Community](https://t.me/NEAR_Tools_Community_Group)\\\\n- [ZK Community](https://t.me/NearZeroKnowledge)\\\\n- [Documentation Community](https://t.me/neardocscg)\\\\n- [Wallet Builders](https://nearbuilders.com/tg-wallet)\\\\n- [Contracts Community](https://t.me/nearnft)\\\\n- [NEAR Devs](https://t.me/neardev)\\\\n- [Jutsu and BOS questions](https://t.me/tryjutsu/973)\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### Quote of the week: \\\\n\\\\n**Efte** from tools community: \\\\\\\"I Just wanna give a big shoutout to Lyudmil (DevHub DevRel) who has just spent multiple hours explaining the ins and outs of a fungible token contract with me. I am sure I will now not only be able to interact and create those, but also have a better overview of what sources to go to whenever I am stuck with other examples. I will put this to the test soon by creating contracts interacting with the ft contracts on different levels.\\\\\\\"\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n###### NEAR Dev NEWS is curated by the NEAR Dev NEWS group , and maintained by @victorkanu1.near & @orangejoe.near \\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n![Sample Image](https://i.ibb.co/MDJ5zZn/2024-04-03-16-10-19.jpg)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n##### Thanks for reading, See you Next Week!", "metadata": {"id": "3235", "title": " NEAR Dev NEWS #7", "author": "victorkanu1.near", "status": "DRAFT", "category": "news", "subtitle": "Engage with NEAR", "createdAt": "2024-04-11", "updatedAt": "2024-04-11", "description": "Engage with NEAR", "publishedAt": "2024-04-11", "communityAddonId": "blogv2"}}}}}}

{"data": {"blog": {"near-dev-news-6-3237": {"": "\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nWelcome to NEAR Dev NEWS, your prime source for the latest in the NEAR Developer ecosystem! NEAR lays the groundwork for all blockchain apps, offering an open-source system empowering devs to create fully decentralized, interoperable apps. Our Digest showcases developer progress and technical updates shaping the blockchain OS.\\\\n\\\\nBefore we kick into updates for the new week, please take the time to fill out our survey and play a pivotal role in shaping the ecosystem. Your feedback will provide valuable info to builders and contributors, paving the way for FRPs (Request for proposals) on DevHub. \\\\n\\\\n###### [CLICK HERE TO FILL SURVEY \\\\u{1f3c6}](https://bit.ly/devhub-survey-q1-2024)\\\\n\\\\nThank you for participating, now let\\\\u{2019}s get into the updates!\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### FEATURED RELEASES & PR\\\\\\'s \\\\u{1f929}\\\\n\\\\n- **NEAR Rust SDK 5.1 IS OUT!** The highlights of the release can be found \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/releases/tag/near-sdk-v5.1.0).\\\\n\\\\n- `nearcore`: Version 1.38.1 has been released . This does not contain a protocol upgrade and it is optional. However, we recommend all node operators to upgrade to this release since it brings performance improvements. Learn more \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/nearcore/releases/tag/1.38.1)\\\\n\\\\n- Discover more in releases and merged pull requests in our changelog \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://docs.near.org/changelog/2024/02/29/#-documentation).\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### DEVELOPER UPDATES \\\\u{1f6e0}\\\\n\\\\n- The Ledger App for NEAR,  is currently undergoing a comprehensive security audit. We anticipate having the final report ready by April 22nd!\\\\n\\\\nExciting new features included in this version:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} Support for transactions of any size, with streaming preview implementation.\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} Capability for signing meta-transactions (DelegatedAction).\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} Added support for message signing NEP.\\\\n\\\\nThis is a significant milestone for Near Ledger users, promising enhanced functionality and security. Stay tuned for the official report release on April 22nd!\\\\n\\\\n- There\\\\\\'s a technical discussion about the possibility of running AI as a NEAR smart contract. it\\\\\\'s an interesting topic worth exploring further. Learn more \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://twitter.com/ekuzyakov/status/1756812617505542578)\\\\n\\\\n- Pagoda launches Multichain Gas Relayer which removes the need for users to have the native gas token of another chain in order to transact; instead they can just use NEAR or NEP-141 tokens to cover gas on any chain, not just NEAR or EVM chains.\\\\n\\\\n-  Pagoda releases Chain Signatures that simplify user experiences by enabling users multichain access without leaving their NEAR account, unlocking billions of dollars in previously inaccessible liquidity.\\\\n\\\\n- There\\\\\\'s an ongoing discussion regarding an issue with building contracts using `near-sdk-js`. It seems that deploying to a fresh account might resolve the issue. For more information and troubleshooting steps, check out the \\\\u{1f449} [documentation](https://docs.near.org/tutorials/examples/update-contract-migrate-state). \\\\n\\\\n- Near-sandbox version 0.0.18 has been published to npm by Vlad Frolov. You can find more information about it \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://www.npmjs.com/package/near-sandbox/v/0.0.18).\\\\n\\\\n- Community members inquire about retrieving the epoch start block height via RPC. Ecosystem Devs suggests accessing it through the validators RPC endpoint, which you can find \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://docs.near.org/api/rpc/network#validation-status).\\\\n\\\\n- Seeking documentation about MultiSig on NEAR. Check out the MultiSig contract repository \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/core-contracts/tree/master/multisig).\\\\n\\\\n- Chain Signatures Launch to Enable Transactions on Any Blockchain from a NEAR Account . Read \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://pages.near.org/blog/chain-signatures-launch-to-enable-transactions-on-any-blockchain-from-a-near-account/)\\\\n\\\\n- Proximity labs shares Ideas for building with chain signatures \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://twitter.com/proximityfi/status/1774723437032038408?t=Y_oem9i384uPvwRIZKOuiw&s=35).\\\\n\\\\n- Users encountered an issue where the RPC response required more NEAR for a transaction than specified in the frontend. Ecosystem Devs suggested updating dependencies or removing package-lock.\\\\n\\\\n- Users reported encountering a 502 Server Error when attempting to call a view method on a testnet contract, which was later resolved.\\\\n\\\\n- Did you know there are multiple Rust CLI tools available for different purposes within the NEAR ecosystem? These include:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} `near-cli-rs`: [A general-purpose CLI tool for NEAR protocol operations and interactions](https://github.com/near/near-cli-rs).\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} `bos-cli-rs`: Specifically designed for BOS development, offering dedicated commands for working with BOS contracts and components.\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} `cargo-near`: [A Rust Cargo extension tailored for Rust contract development on the NEAR platform, providing commands for project creation, building, and deployment](https://github.com/near/cargo-near).\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} `near-validator`: Geared towards NEAR validator operators, offering commands for validator management and operations.\\\\n\\\\n- SourceScan was mentioned as a tool that can build and deploy contracts from source code. Check it out \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://near.org/sourcescan.near/widget/SourceScan).\\\\n\\\\n-  Developers discuss the possibility of estimating gas limits for contract calls, similar to `eth_estimateGas` in Ethereum. They also discussed potential methods and shared insights into gas estimation practices on NEAR.\\\\n\\\\n- Developers discussed their experiences with both `near-cli-js` and `near-cli-rs`, sharing preferences and observations. Some found `near-cli-rs` to be more up-to-date and actively maintained compared to `near-cli-js`. However, there were differing opinions on ease of use, with some users expressing satisfaction with `near-cli-js` due to its familiarity and simplicity. Others, however, praised the features and reliability of `near-cli-rs`, especially for more advanced use cases.\\\\n\\\\n- The latest `FASTNEAR API` returns FT balances. Discover more \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://twitter.com/fast_near/status/1773398764859847008)\\\\n\\\\n- Introducing TOP100 token holders API. For every FT on NEAR, get realtime top 100 accounts. Read the \\\\u{1f449} [docs](https://github.com/fastnear/fastnear-api-server-rs?tab=readme-ov-file#token-id-to-top-100-accounts-by-balance-for-ft-contracts).\\\\n\\\\n- Developers discussed potential future extensions and functionalities that could be integrated into a unified CLI tool for NEAR-related commands. Suggestions included incorporating additional features for managing validator nodes, optimizing contract deployment processes, and enhancing developer tools for contract testing and debugging.\\\\n\\\\n- Several discussions have arisen regarding transaction order and processing efficiency on NEAR Protocol. Suggestions have been made to introduce a `broadcast_tx_async` option to improve user experience, particularly in scenarios where transaction order is not critical, such as bulk airdrops and gaming applications. The proposal aims to allow dApp developers to specify transaction ordering preferences through wallet selectors, enhancing flexibility and improving overall user experience. To discover more about recent RPC endpoint changes related to transaction processing, check out the documentation updates \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://docs.near.org/api/rpc/transactions#send-tx).\\\\n\\\\n- A suggestion is made to yank version 0.7.1 of `near-sandbox-utils` and publish it as version 0.8.0 to ensure compatibility with older `nearcore` versions. Action is taken to remove version 0.7.1 and re-release it as version 0.8.0\\\\n\\\\n- An announcement was made to contract developers about the removal of dev-accounts (dev-X-Y format) in NEAR since `nearcore` v1.37. An issue related to this change is opened in the rs sandbox testing repository\\\\n\\\\n- Ongoing development on a new API wrapper aimed at reducing boilerplate code.\\\\n\\\\n- Mark your calendars! The Tools Community Call is now scheduled at a regular interval. Starting next week on April 9th, it will convene every second Tuesday of the month at 5 pm UTC. Additionally, don\\\\\\'t forget about our Docs Community Call, which occurs every 3rd Wednesday of the month, with the next one set for April 17th. Whether you want to share your work, propose discussion topics, or stay updated with the latest news, join the DevHub communities and get involved (Links can be found at the bottom of the newsletter)!\\\\n\\\\n- We had discussions on integrating BOS\\\\\\'s Social API into a Node.js project with suggestions for creating a wrapper using naxios.\\\\nCheck out \\\\u{1f449}[Naxios Repository](https://github.com/wpdas/naxios). \\\\n\\\\n- NEAR\\\\\\'s announces partnership with ETHDam (12-14th of April). Join this chat if you\\\\\\'ll be attending [ETHDam Hackathon](https://t.me/+l1hv9RxZCCVkNzA0).\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### THIS WEEKS TIPS \\\\u{1f4a1}\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: For more resources on Chain Signatures, check out this \\\\u{1f449} [linktree](https://linktr.ee/chainsignatures).\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: You can re-create a transaction in [near.cli.rs](https://github.com/near/near-cli-rs), edit it and send again with ease. Using interactive mode of near CLI, select \\\\\\\"transaction\\\\\\\" -> \\\\\\\"reconstruct-transaction\\\\\\\". You will get a new CLI command constructed for you to edit and run.\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: If you run a TESTNET validator node, please update it to the [1.38 version](https://github.com/near/nearcore/releases/tag/1.38.0-rc.2). Currently voting for this release is blocked due to insufficient nodes running the version. The 1.38.0-rc.2 is only to be used on TESTNET.\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: Encountering issues with RPC or importing accounts? Dive into community discussions to find solutions and support: [Link to Community](https://t.me/neardev).\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip` List of all the current NEAR Stakers: https://near-staking.com\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: The most effective method to report CLI issues is through the relevant GitHub repository issues: [near-cli GitHub Issues](https://github.com/near/near-cli/issues)\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: **New to NEAR? \\\\u{1f468}\\\\u{200d}\\\\u{1f4bb} :** Whether you\\\\\\'re familiar with Rust , JS, or simply eager to contribute to NEAR tooling, begin your journey with comprehensive NEAR docs and DevHub resources \\\\u{1f447}:\\\\n\\\\n1. NEAR docs: [Link](https://docs.near.org/)\\\\n2. DevHub: [Link](https://neardevhub.org/)\\\\n3. Join the Community: Have questions? Join the lively discussions in [neardev](https://t.me/neardev) Telegram group.\\\\n4. Office Hours: Get personalized assistance during our [DevHub Office Hours](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=devrel&tab=office-hours).\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### ETHSeoul \\\\u{1f1f0}\\\\u{1f1f7}\\\\n\\\\nAt ETHSeoul, the DevHub devrels engaged developers with exciting bounties and insightful talks. We kicked off the event with NEAR ecosystem bounties, encouraging cross-chain product development and AI governance innovation. Talks by experts like Mike from proximity and Boris Polania from DevHub captivated the audience, providing valuable insights into Chain Signatures and decentralized intelligence. The event showcased remarkable projects, such as DeFiBrain and Connor AI, which stood out for their groundbreaking innovations. DeFiBrain, the winner of the Chain Signatures track, presented an advanced DeFi investment AI assistant powered by AI and NEAR technology. \\\\n\\\\nOn the other hand, Connor AI, winner of the AI Governance is NEAR bounty, showcased an innovative integration of AI into DAOs, automating execution processes and empowering decentralized decision-making. \\\\n\\\\nThese projects exemplified the cutting-edge applications of AI and blockchain technology, reflecting the spirit of innovation at ETHSeoul 2024.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n![Sample Image](https://i.ibb.co/jLKdRyz/GJ-8-V5-La-YAEMr-GN.jpg)\\\\n  \\\\n**Special thanks to the judges and participants for their contributions to the vibrant developer community at ETHSeoul 2024!**\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### RECENTLY UPDATED NEP\\\\\\'S \\\\u{2705}\\\\n\\\\n**APPROVED NEPs**: \\\\n\\\\nA successful NEP is one that addresses a specific problem or needs within the NEAR ecosystem. These are the NEPs that were approved by the protocol workgroup this week:\\\\n\\\\n- [NEP-519: Support for yielded execution](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/519) - Protocol Update | **8th March 2024**\\\\n- [NEP-491: Non-Refunable Storage](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/491) - Protocol Update | **26th Feb 2024**\\\\n  \\\\n\\\\n**REVIEW STAGE**:\\\\n\\\\nSubject matter experts are currently reviewing the following NEPs. Some of the working group members are also deciding whether to accept or reject them. Feel free to explore, these NEPs will aid you during your development as you integrate them with your dApps. Share your thoughts and leave a comment.\\\\n\\\\n- [NEP-330: Build details extension](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/533) - Contract standards Update | **5th March 2024**\\\\n- [NEP-393: Add class metadata interface](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/528) - Contract Standards Update | **26th Feb 2024**\\\\n- [NEP-483: Prefix Tag for signed messages](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/483) - Protocol Update | **26th Feb 2024**\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nTo learn more about NEP\\\\\\'s click \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0001.md) \\\\nTo view all the NEP\\\\\\'s click \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/orgs/near/projects/51/views/1)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### HACKS OF THE WEEK \\\\u{1f468}\\\\u{200d}\\\\u{1f4bb}\\\\u{1f3c6}\\\\n\\\\n- Check out the RPC Selector browser extension for NEAR, allowing you to customize RPC endpoints for dapps and wallets: [GitHub - RPC Selector](https://github.com/Sliman4/rpc-selector)\\\\n\\\\n- A community member shared their success in winning the 3rd place in the EthSeoul2024 hackathon track and provided a link to their project. [Gajami Project](https://devfolio.co/projects/gajami-f679)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### STAKEWARS \\\\u{1f680}\\\\n**Participating in Stakewars? Here are some quick news and notes you should be aware of.**\\\\n\\\\n- Due to popular demand, the Stake Wars IV period has been extended until the end of April. For updated reward criteria and more details, please refer to the \\\\u{1f449}[rewards documentation](https://github.com/near/stakewars-iv/blob/main/REWARDS.md).\\\\n\\\\n- We\\\\\\'re pleased to announce that state sync issues have been fixed! No binary update is required. Simply change back `state_sync_enabled:` true and restart your node. For detailed instructions, refer to \\\\u{1f449} [this guide](https://github.com/near/stakewars-iv/blob/main/HOW_TO.md).\\\\n\\\\n- It\\\\\\'s essential to update your nodes to the latest version. Find the instructions for node update \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/stakewars-iv/blob/main/HOW_TO.md#node-update).\\\\n\\\\n- Users can submit bug reports for rewards \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/stakewars-iv/blob/main/REWARDS.md#2-bug-bounty).\\\\n\\\\n- We\\\\\\'re currently investigating chunk validation errors reported by some nodes. Stay tuned for updates!\\\\n\\\\n- Join the excitement of the second round of Wheel of Transactions at [Learn NEAR Club](https://learnnear.club/wheel-of-transactions-second-round/)!\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### CHAIN ABSTRACTION COMMUNITY\\\\u{1f929}\\\\n\\\\nComprising of hackathon participants and developers, the chain abstraction community has been engaged in discussions exploring various aspects of the technology and its potential applications. Participants exchanged ideas on projects such as account aggregation, cross-chain token arbitrage bots, multichain DEXs, lending platforms, and NFT marketplaces across multiple blockchains.\\\\n\\\\nTechnical discussions cover topics like deriving foreign addresses, integrating with Ethereum Layer 2 solutions, and utilizing MPC contracts for transaction signing. Members are exploring the development of multichain applications, utilizing chain signatures to enable seamless interoperability across various blockchain networks.\\\\n\\\\nDevelopers have also provided valuable feedback on the usability and functionality of tools and SDKs related to chain abstraction, highlighting areas for improvement such as, enhanced SDK typings, and standardized CLI commands.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nFor further details, you can refer to the following links:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [Chain Signatures Documentation](https://docs.near.org/concepts/abstraction/chain-signatures)\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [NEAR Multichain Example](https://github.com/near-examples/near-multichain)\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [Chain Signatures Use Cases](https://docs.near.org/concepts/abstraction/signatures/use-cases)\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [FastAuth SDK Documentation](https://docs.near.org/tools/fastauth-sdk)\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [NEAR NFT Minting on Farcaster](https://warpcast.com/brower1/0xab61fd1b)\\\\n\\\\n[Learn more about the Chain Abstraction Community](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=chain-abstraction)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### CALL FOR CONTRIBUTORS \\\\u{1f4de}\\\\n\\\\n- NEAR Blocks is officially deployed on BOS. As a reminder, we are also open source - feel free to contribute \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://t.co/oaH82pEnQ3)\\\\n\\\\n- We\\\\\\'ve initiated alpha testing the BOS web engine for creating decentralized front end components on NEAR. Get involved today by following this [link](https://bwe-docs.near.dev/).\\\\n\\\\n-  Ecosystem developers propose a devcontainer image for examples encompassing both Rust and Node tooling. Volunteers are welcomed to contribute to `near-devcontainers` and test the additional container on examples. [Join Tools Community](https://t.me/NEAR_Tools_Community_Group).\\\\n\\\\n- Check out [DevHub\\\\\\'s On-Chain Quests](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=challenges) \\\\u{26f3}\\\\u{fe0f}, where you\\\\\\'ll find a dynamic array of challenges across various communities, earning recognition and respect as you conquer each one! \\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n# UPCOMING EVENTS \\\\n\\\\n### VIRTUAL:\\\\n- April 4 | X space : Wasmcov meets NEAR | [Set reminder](https://twitter.com/i/spaces/1MYxNoAjnAXKw/peek)\\\\n- April 17 | Documentation community call | [Add to Calendar](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/r/eventedit/copy/NjhpcWZjN20yaGxvdnMzdjg2Mm45MGdtYWRfMjAyNDA0MTdUMTcwMDAwWiBjX2Y1NGVkMzdmZDkyMzI3YWNkYzdlNDM0M2ZlNDA3MjJhZTU3OTdiNmM4MjkyOWJhOTNlOWYzYTg5YzY5NjU3YWJAZw)\\\\n\\\\n### ASIA:\\\\n\\\\n- April 6-9, 2024 | Hong Kong Web3 Festival 2024 | Hong Kong | HashKey and Wanxiang | BD to speak\\\\n\\\\n### MIDDLE EAST\\\\n- April 15-16, 2024 | [Blockchain Life 2024](https://blockchain-life.com/asia/en/spring2024/?utm_source=google&utm_medium=organic) | Dubai | Blockchain Life | NEAR Foundation, Arpit has a speaker slot\\\\n- April 18-19, 2024 | [Token 2049 Dubai](https://www.dubai.token2049.com/) | Dubai | | NEAR Foundation organizing booth. {"data": {"neardevnews.community.devhub.near": {"blog": {"near-dev-news-6-3237": {"": "\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nWelcome to NEAR Dev NEWS, your prime source for the latest in the NEAR Developer ecosystem! NEAR lays the groundwork for all blockchain apps, offering an open-source system empowering devs to create fully decentralized, interoperable apps. Our Digest showcases developer progress and technical updates shaping the blockchain OS.\\\\n\\\\nBefore we kick into updates for the new week, please take the time to fill out our survey and play a pivotal role in shaping the ecosystem. Your feedback will provide valuable info to builders and contributors, paving the way for FRPs (Request for proposals) on DevHub. \\\\n\\\\n###### [CLICK HERE TO FILL SURVEY \\\\u{1f3c6}](https://bit.ly/devhub-survey-q1-2024)\\\\n\\\\nThank you for participating, now let\\\\u{2019}s get into the updates!\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### FEATURED RELEASES & PR\\\\\\'s \\\\u{1f929}\\\\n\\\\n- **NEAR Rust SDK 5.1 IS OUT!** The highlights of the release can be found \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/releases/tag/near-sdk-v5.1.0).\\\\n\\\\n- `nearcore`: Version 1.38.1 has been released . This does not contain a protocol upgrade and it is optional. However, we recommend all node operators to upgrade to this release since it brings performance improvements. Learn more \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/nearcore/releases/tag/1.38.1)\\\\n\\\\n- Discover more in releases and merged pull requests in our changelog \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://docs.near.org/changelog/2024/02/29/#-documentation).\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### DEVELOPER UPDATES \\\\u{1f6e0}\\\\n\\\\n- The Ledger App for NEAR,  is currently undergoing a comprehensive security audit. We anticipate having the final report ready by April 22nd!\\\\n\\\\nExciting new features included in this version:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} Support for transactions of any size, with streaming preview implementation.\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} Capability for signing meta-transactions (DelegatedAction).\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} Added support for message signing NEP.\\\\n\\\\nThis is a significant milestone for Near Ledger users, promising enhanced functionality and security. Stay tuned for the official report release on April 22nd!\\\\n\\\\n- There\\\\\\'s a technical discussion about the possibility of running AI as a NEAR smart contract. it\\\\\\'s an interesting topic worth exploring further. Learn more \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://twitter.com/ekuzyakov/status/1756812617505542578)\\\\n\\\\n- Pagoda launches Multichain Gas Relayer which removes the need for users to have the native gas token of another chain in order to transact; instead they can just use NEAR or NEP-141 tokens to cover gas on any chain, not just NEAR or EVM chains.\\\\n\\\\n-  Pagoda releases Chain Signatures that simplify user experiences by enabling users multichain access without leaving their NEAR account, unlocking billions of dollars in previously inaccessible liquidity.\\\\n\\\\n- There\\\\\\'s an ongoing discussion regarding an issue with building contracts using `near-sdk-js`. It seems that deploying to a fresh account might resolve the issue. For more information and troubleshooting steps, check out the \\\\u{1f449} [documentation](https://docs.near.org/tutorials/examples/update-contract-migrate-state). \\\\n\\\\n- Near-sandbox version 0.0.18 has been published to npm by Vlad Frolov. You can find more information about it \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://www.npmjs.com/package/near-sandbox/v/0.0.18).\\\\n\\\\n- Community members inquire about retrieving the epoch start block height via RPC. Ecosystem Devs suggests accessing it through the validators RPC endpoint, which you can find \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://docs.near.org/api/rpc/network#validation-status).\\\\n\\\\n- Seeking documentation about MultiSig on NEAR. Check out the MultiSig contract repository \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/core-contracts/tree/master/multisig).\\\\n\\\\n- Chain Signatures Launch to Enable Transactions on Any Blockchain from a NEAR Account . Read \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://pages.near.org/blog/chain-signatures-launch-to-enable-transactions-on-any-blockchain-from-a-near-account/)\\\\n\\\\n- Proximity labs shares Ideas for building with chain signatures \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://twitter.com/proximityfi/status/1774723437032038408?t=Y_oem9i384uPvwRIZKOuiw&s=35).\\\\n\\\\n- Users encountered an issue where the RPC response required more NEAR for a transaction than specified in the frontend. Ecosystem Devs suggested updating dependencies or removing package-lock.\\\\n\\\\n- Users reported encountering a 502 Server Error when attempting to call a view method on a testnet contract, which was later resolved.\\\\n\\\\n- Did you know there are multiple Rust CLI tools available for different purposes within the NEAR ecosystem? These include:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} `near-cli-rs`: [A general-purpose CLI tool for NEAR protocol operations and interactions](https://github.com/near/near-cli-rs).\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} `bos-cli-rs`: Specifically designed for BOS development, offering dedicated commands for working with BOS contracts and components.\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} `cargo-near`: [A Rust Cargo extension tailored for Rust contract development on the NEAR platform, providing commands for project creation, building, and deployment](https://github.com/near/cargo-near).\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} `near-validator`: Geared towards NEAR validator operators, offering commands for validator management and operations.\\\\n\\\\n- SourceScan was mentioned as a tool that can build and deploy contracts from source code. Check it out \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://near.org/sourcescan.near/widget/SourceScan).\\\\n\\\\n-  Developers discuss the possibility of estimating gas limits for contract calls, similar to `eth_estimateGas` in Ethereum. They also discussed potential methods and shared insights into gas estimation practices on NEAR.\\\\n\\\\n- Developers discussed their experiences with both `near-cli-js` and `near-cli-rs`, sharing preferences and observations. Some found `near-cli-rs` to be more up-to-date and actively maintained compared to `near-cli-js`. However, there were differing opinions on ease of use, with some users expressing satisfaction with `near-cli-js` due to its familiarity and simplicity. Others, however, praised the features and reliability of `near-cli-rs`, especially for more advanced use cases.\\\\n\\\\n- The latest `FASTNEAR API` returns FT balances. Discover more \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://twitter.com/fast_near/status/1773398764859847008)\\\\n\\\\n- Introducing TOP100 token holders API. For every FT on NEAR, get realtime top 100 accounts. Read the \\\\u{1f449} [docs](https://github.com/fastnear/fastnear-api-server-rs?tab=readme-ov-file#token-id-to-top-100-accounts-by-balance-for-ft-contracts).\\\\n\\\\n- Developers discussed potential future extensions and functionalities that could be integrated into a unified CLI tool for NEAR-related commands. Suggestions included incorporating additional features for managing validator nodes, optimizing contract deployment processes, and enhancing developer tools for contract testing and debugging.\\\\n\\\\n- Several discussions have arisen regarding transaction order and processing efficiency on NEAR Protocol. Suggestions have been made to introduce a `broadcast_tx_async` option to improve user experience, particularly in scenarios where transaction order is not critical, such as bulk airdrops and gaming applications. The proposal aims to allow dApp developers to specify transaction ordering preferences through wallet selectors, enhancing flexibility and improving overall user experience. To discover more about recent RPC endpoint changes related to transaction processing, check out the documentation updates \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://docs.near.org/api/rpc/transactions#send-tx).\\\\n\\\\n- A suggestion is made to yank version 0.7.1 of `near-sandbox-utils` and publish it as version 0.8.0 to ensure compatibility with older `nearcore` versions. Action is taken to remove version 0.7.1 and re-release it as version 0.8.0\\\\n\\\\n- An announcement was made to contract developers about the removal of dev-accounts (dev-X-Y format) in NEAR since `nearcore` v1.37. An issue related to this change is opened in the rs sandbox testing repository\\\\n\\\\n- Ongoing development on a new API wrapper aimed at reducing boilerplate code.\\\\n\\\\n- Mark your calendars! The Tools Community Call is now scheduled at a regular interval. Starting next week on April 9th, it will convene every second Tuesday of the month at 5 pm UTC. Additionally, don\\\\\\'t forget about our Docs Community Call, which occurs every 3rd Wednesday of the month, with the next one set for April 17th. Whether you want to share your work, propose discussion topics, or stay updated with the latest news, join the DevHub communities and get involved (Links can be found at the bottom of the newsletter)!\\\\n\\\\n- We had discussions on integrating BOS\\\\\\'s Social API into a Node.js project with suggestions for creating a wrapper using naxios.\\\\nCheck out \\\\u{1f449}[Naxios Repository](https://github.com/wpdas/naxios). \\\\n\\\\n- NEAR\\\\\\'s announces partnership with ETHDam (12-14th of April). Join this chat if you\\\\\\'ll be attending [ETHDam Hackathon](https://t.me/+l1hv9RxZCCVkNzA0).\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### THIS WEEKS TIPS \\\\u{1f4a1}\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: For more resources on Chain Signatures, check out this \\\\u{1f449} [linktree](https://linktr.ee/chainsignatures).\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: You can re-create a transaction in [near.cli.rs](https://github.com/near/near-cli-rs), edit it and send again with ease. Using interactive mode of near CLI, select \\\\\\\"transaction\\\\\\\" -> \\\\\\\"reconstruct-transaction\\\\\\\". You will get a new CLI command constructed for you to edit and run.\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: If you run a TESTNET validator node, please update it to the [1.38 version](https://github.com/near/nearcore/releases/tag/1.38.0-rc.2). Currently voting for this release is blocked due to insufficient nodes running the version. The 1.38.0-rc.2 is only to be used on TESTNET.\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: Encountering issues with RPC or importing accounts? Dive into community discussions to find solutions and support: [Link to Community](https://t.me/neardev).\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip` List of all the current NEAR Stakers: https://near-staking.com\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: The most effective method to report CLI issues is through the relevant GitHub repository issues: [near-cli GitHub Issues](https://github.com/near/near-cli/issues)\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: **New to NEAR? \\\\u{1f468}\\\\u{200d}\\\\u{1f4bb} :** Whether you\\\\\\'re familiar with Rust , JS, or simply eager to contribute to NEAR tooling, begin your journey with comprehensive NEAR docs and DevHub resources \\\\u{1f447}:\\\\n\\\\n1. Join the lively discussions in [neardev](https://t.me/neardev) Telegram group.\\\\n4. Office Hours: Get personalized assistance during our [DevHub Office Hours](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=devrel&tab=office-hours).\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### ETHSeoul \\\\u{1f1f0}\\\\u{1f1f7}\\\\n\\\\nAt ETHSeoul, the DevHub devrels engaged developers with exciting bounties and insightful talks. The event showcased remarkable projects, such as DeFiBrain and Connor AI, which stood out for their groundbreaking innovations. DeFiBrain, the winner of the Chain Signatures track, presented an advanced DeFi investment AI assistant powered by AI and NEAR technology. \\\\n\\\\nOn the other hand, Connor AI, winner of the AI Governance is NEAR bounty, showcased an innovative integration of AI into DAOs, automating execution processes and empowering decentralized decision-making. \\\\n\\\\nThese projects exemplified the cutting-edge applications of AI and blockchain technology, reflecting the spirit of innovation at ETHSeoul 2024.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n![Sample Image](https://i.ibb.co/jLKdRyz/GJ-8-V5-La-YAEMr-GN.jpg)\\\\n  \\\\n**Special thanks to the judges and participants for their contributions to the vibrant developer community at ETHSeoul 2024!**\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### RECENTLY UPDATED NEP\\\\\\'S \\\\u{2705}\\\\n\\\\n**APPROVED NEPs**: \\\\n\\\\nA successful NEP is one that addresses a specific problem or needs within the NEAR ecosystem.
