Get involved today by following this [link](https://bwe-docs.near.dev/).\\\\n\\\\n-  Ecosystem developers propose a devcontainer image for examples encompassing both Rust and Node tooling. Volunteers are welcomed to contribute to `near-devcontainers` and test the additional container on examples. [Join Tools Community](https://t.me/NEAR_Tools_Community_Group).\\\\n\\\\n- Check out [DevHub\\\\\\'s On-Chain Quests](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=challenges) \\\\u{26f3}\\\\u{fe0f}, where you\\\\\\'ll find a dynamic array of challenges across various communities, earning recognition and respect as you conquer each one! \\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n# UPCOMING EVENTS \\\\n\\\\n### VIRTUAL:\\\\n- April 4 | X space : Wasmcov meets NEAR | [Set reminder](https://twitter.com/i/spaces/1MYxNoAjnAXKw/peek)\\\\n- April 17 | Documentation community call | [Add to Calendar](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/r/eventedit/copy/NjhpcWZjN20yaGxvdnMzdjg2Mm45MGdtYWRfMjAyNDA0MTdUMTcwMDAwWiBjX2Y1NGVkMzdmZDkyMzI3YWNkYzdlNDM0M2ZlNDA3MjJhZTU3OTdiNmM4MjkyOWJhOTNlOWYzYTg5YzY5NjU3YWJAZw)\\\\n\\\\n### ASIA:\\\\n\\\\n- April 6-9, 2024 | Hong Kong Web3 Festival 2024 | Hong Kong | HashKey and Wanxiang | BD to speak\\\\n\\\\n### MIDDLE EAST\\\\n- April 15-16, 2024 | [Blockchain Life 2024](https://blockchain-life.com/asia/en/spring2024/?utm_source=google&utm_medium=organic) | Dubai | Blockchain Life | NEAR Foundation, Arpit has a speaker slot\\\\n- April 18-19, 2024 | [Token 2049 Dubai](https://www.dubai.token2049.com/) | Dubai | | NEAR Foundation organizing booth. Illia, Chris speaking\\\\n- April 22-23, 2024 | World Blockchain Summit 2024 | Dubai | Trescon | NEAR Foundation, tentative speaker slot for Arpit\\\\n\\\\n### EUROPE\\\\n- April 8-12, 2024 | [Paris Blockchain Week](https://www.parisblockchainweek.com/) | Paris, France | | NF leading; Chris D speaking\\\\nApril 12-14, 2024 | [ETHDam](https://www.ethdam.com/) | Amsterdam, Netherlands | ETHDam | DevHub\\\\n\\\\n### THE UNITED STATES \\\\n- April 3-5, 2024 | [NFT.NYC](https://www.nft.nyc/) | New York, NY | NFT.NYC\\\\n- April | San Francisco | Funding the Commons (AI Focused Day) | FtheC | Banyan + EDGE\\\\n- April 18-19, 2024 | The Institutional Crypto Conference East | New York, NY \\\\n- April 29 - May 3, 2024 | [5th Annual International Tech Summit](https://www.internationaltechsummit.com/) | Hamilton, Bermuda | Penrose | \\\\\\\"Abhi V / Olga Chris D / Abhi speaking\\\\\\\"\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\nIf you are running a Local NEAR event please register as a Hackbox host [here](https://near.org/hackbox.near/widget/home). \\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n## CONSENSUS 2024\\\\nExciting opportunities await those interested in participating in the upcoming Consensus event. Choose from three ticket options tailored for the NEAR Ecosystem:\\\\n\\\\n- Hackathon Developer Pass: For active developers and open-source contributors committed to participating in-person at the EasyA Consensus Hackathon on May 29-31, A complimentary Developer Pass is offered to approved applicants until capacity is reached. Apply \\\\u{1f449}[here](https://consensus2024.coindesk.com/apply/developer-hackathon/-id/0).\\\\n\\\\n- Developer Pass: Special $109 rate available for active Web3 and Web2 developers. Apply before prices increase on March 15th [here](https://consensus2024.coindesk.com/apply/developer/-id/0). The Developer Pass grants access to all three days of Consensus on May 29-31.  \\\\n\\\\n- 15% off Pro Passes and Explorer Passes: Enjoy a 15% discount on Pro Passes and Explorer Passes using the code \\\\\\\"NEAR\\\\\\\" [here](https://consensus2024.coindesk.com/register?promo=NEAR).\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n## JOIN COMMUNITIES - TG CHANNELS \\\\n- [Protocol Community](https://t.me/NEAR_Protocol_Community_Group)\\\\n- [Stake-wars](https://t.me/near_stake_wars)\\\\n- [Tools Community](https://t.me/NEAR_Tools_Community_Group)\\\\n- [ZK Community](https://t.me/NearZeroKnowledge)\\\\n- [Documentation Community](https://t.me/neardocscg)\\\\n- [Wallet Builders](https://nearbuilders.com/tg-wallet)\\\\n- [Contracts Community](https://t.me/nearnft)\\\\n- [NEAR Devs](https://t.me/neardev)\\\\n- [Jutsu and BOS questions](https://t.me/tryjutsu/973)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n###### NEAR Dev NEWS is curated by the NEAR Dev NEWS group , and maintained by @victorkanu1.near & @orangejoe.near \\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n![Sample Image](https://i.ibb.co/MDJ5zZn/2024-04-03-16-10-19.jpg)\\\\n\\\\n##### Thanks for reading, See you Next Week!\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n", "metadata": {"id": "3237", "title": "NEAR Dev NEWS #6", "author": "victorkanu1.near", "status": "DRAFT", "category": "news", "subtitle": "", "createdAt": "2024-04-03", "updatedAt": "2024-04-03", "description": "", "publishedAt": "2024-04-03", "communityAddonId": "blogv2"}}}}}}

{"data": {"blog": {"near-dev-news-8-3238": {"": "Goedendag, Chain Abstractors! Welcome to NEAR Dev NEWS, your go-to destination for the freshest updates in the NEAR Developer ecosystem! NEAR lays the groundwork for all blockchain apps, offering an open-source system empowering devs to create fully decentralized, interoperable apps. In this edition, we bring you highly anticipated updates from ETHDam. Join us as we showcase the latest developer progress and technical advancements shaping the blockchain OS.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### FEATURED RELEASES & PR\\\\\\'s \\\\u{1f929}\\\\n\\\\n- `create-near-app` **Version** [6.4.0](https://github.com/near/create-near-app/releases/tag/v6.4.0) **has been released!**\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} Sandbox testing now follows the same language as the contract created\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} Removed vanilla frontend since very few people was using it\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} Frontend now creates FC key for hello.near-examples.testnet by default\\\\n\\\\n- `near-rust-sdk` **version 5.1.0 has been released**. The highlights of the release can be found \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/releases/tag/near-sdk-v5.1.0).\\\\n\\\\n- `nearcore` **Version 1.39.0 has been released** this week and function call base cost is reduced. For small transactions like on [Cosmose](https://twitter.com/Cosmose_) and [hotdao](https://twitter.com/hotdao_), it is a 2x reduction in cost and 2x in throughput. RPC is now faster! Learn more \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/nearcore/releases)\\\\n\\\\n- `near-api-js` **Version 4.0.0 has been released**. It contains:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} More than 36% bundle size reduction (from 380kb to 240kb). Info \\\\u{1f449}[here](https://bundlephobia.com/package/near-api-js@4.0.0)\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} Failover RPC configuration\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} Executing view functions without the need of a Connection object and more!\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} You can read more about the changes \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/near-api-js/pull/1318)!\\\\n\\\\n- `Wallet Selector` **Version 8.9.6 has been released**:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} Github --> https://github.com/near/wallet-selector/tree/v8.9.6\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} NPM --> https://www.npmjs.com/package/@near-wallet-selector/core\\\\n\\\\n- Discover more in releases and merged pull requests in our changelog \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://docs.near.org/changelog/2024/02/29/#-documentation).\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### DEVELOPER UPDATES \\\\u{1f6e0}\\\\n\\\\n- **Pagoda**: Pagoda has released [Access Keys indexer](https://near.org/dataplatform.near/widget/QueryApi.App?selectedIndexerPath=dataplatform.near/access_keys_v1) powered by QueryAPI that could be used as a drop-in replacement for KitWallet endpoint for access keys. This is yet another critical indexer powered by QueryAPI, built to showcase its reliability for critical applications. QueryAPI is currently in closed beta. You can request access [here](http://bit.ly/near-queryapi-beta) and read more in the [docs](https://docs.near.org/build/data-infrastructure/query-api/intro).\\\\n\\\\n- **Pagoda**: Has released the NFT Key Smart Contract. The MPC Account Recovery smart contract provides a sign method that accepts a path parameter. This allows one predecessor account to have access to an effectively unlimited number of MPC keys. The NFT Chain Keys contract takes advantage of this property and allows secure transfers of MPC keys between users, using the NEP-171 NFT contract standard. The contract also implements new functionality to enable chain key management features.\\\\n\\\\nDocs \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://docs.near.org/build/chain-abstraction/nft-chain-keys)\\\\n\\\\n- **Rust Version and Cargo Update**: Community members have shared insights on updating Rust versions and cargo dependencies for NEAR projects. Ensure that your `rust-toolchain.toml` file reflects the latest Rust version, and consider updating dependencies with `cargo update`. Additionally, the `cargo-near` tool has fixed issues with starting templates.\\\\n\\\\n- **Init Attribute Error**: Developers have encountered issues with the `#[init]` attribute in NEAR smart contracts. This error can be resolved by checking the Rust version, ensuring the correct usage of attributes, and using unique method names to avoid naming collisions. Refer to the [NEAR SDK documentation](https://docs.rs/near-sdk/latest/near_sdk/attr.near.html) for detailed information.\\\\n\\\\n- **Serialization and Structs**: Community members seek guidance on using custom structs in NEAR smart contracts. The NEAR DevHub contract repository provides valuable examples of defining and using structs. Explore the [NEAR DevHub repository](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-contract) for reference and best practices.\\\\n\\\\n- **Sharding Configuration**: Developers inquire about configuring sharding for NEAR networks. Understanding how account names determine shard allocation is crucial. Review the latest [shard splits](https://example.com/shard_splits) to ensure optimal deployment strategies.\\\\n\\\\n- **Local Testing and Gas Limit**: Developers look for ways to bypass the 300T gas limit in local integration testing with the NEAR sandbox. Consider using tools like `near-workspaces-rs` and exploring options for adjusting gas limits during local testing.\\\\n\\\\n- **Educational Content for NEAR Chain**: Community developers are actively working on educational content tailored to smart contracts created with the NEAR JavaScript SDK. A recent challenge focused on security issues targeted intermediate users. The challenge aimed to refine skills in handling transactions and ensuring security measures. You can try out the challenge [here](https://staging.agorapp.dev/ide/near/typescript/steal-the-tips/challenge).\\\\n\\\\n- **Documentation Updates**: Our documentation repository recently underwent a significant reorganization, involving over 250 URL changes. We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your patience. Broken links in the documentation have been addressed promptly. If you encounter any issues, please report them [here](https://docs.github.com/), and our team will swiftly resolve them. \\\\n\\\\n- **Promise handling**: Community developers engaged in technical discussions regarding promise handling and behavior in the NEAR JavaScript SDK. Issues such as orphaned promises and transaction atomicity were explored, aiming to align behaviors with other SDKs and ensure consistency.\\\\n\\\\n- **Addressing Signature Verification Challenges.**: The developer community addressed challenges related to signature verification within the wallet selector framework. A member sought assistance in signing and verifying arbitrary messages using the wallet selector, encountering hurdles, especially with signatures obtained from the Wallet.signMessage method. Insights were shared, highlighting compatibility issues with ed25519 signatures and providing resources for reference. These resources include examples from NEP-413, such as the [NEP Example reference](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/98), a [Wallet Selector react example](https://github.com/nearprotocol/wallet-selector), and the [Wallet Selector helper functions repository](https://github.com/nearprotocol/wallet-selector). The community expressed appreciation for the shared resources and expressed intentions to further explore them. \\\\n\\\\n- **NF Update**: NEAR Foundation Launches Infrastructure Committee with $4 Million in Funding. Learn more \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://pages.near.org/blog/near-launches-infrastructure-committee/)\\\\n\\\\n- **DevHub Feature**: All announcements and discussions from DevHub communities in one place!\\\\nClick \\\\u{1f449}[here](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=announcements)\\\\n\\\\n- **Fast NEAR**: Introduces FREE RPC endpoint for NEAR Protocol mainnet. Feel free to use it at [https://free.rpc.fastnear.com](https://t.co/3DVVZmaSFt)\\\\n\\\\n- **MultiSig on NEAR**: Seeking documentation about MultiSig on NEAR. Check out the MultiSig contract repository \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/core-contracts/tree/master/multisig).\\\\n\\\\n- **Protocol WG**: The Protocol Work Group prepares to vote on NEP-536, a proposal to optimize NEAR protocol\\\\\\'s performance. NEP-536 focuses on reducing the number of refund receipts, a significant contributor to runtime overhead. Don\\\\\\'t miss this opportunity to contribute to the discussion \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/536).\\\\n\\\\n- **signMessage issue**: Developers provided an update on the signMessage issue and shared the latest developments on [GitHub](https://github.com/near/near-wallet/issues/3135).\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### THIS WEEKS TIPS \\\\u{1f4a1}\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: A request was made to report broken links. The suggestion was to open an issue on the docs GitHub or make a PR with the proper link. The relevant link for documentation issues is \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://docs.github.com/).\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: You can re-create a transaction in [near.cli.rs](https://github.com/near/near-cli-rs), edit it and send again with ease. Using interactive mode of near CLI, select \\\\\\\"transaction\\\\\\\" -> \\\\\\\"reconstruct-transaction\\\\\\\". You will get a new CLI command constructed for you to edit and run.\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: Need to top-up USDT to a NEAR wallet on the test network? Use a faucet. [Faucet Link](https://near-faucet.io/).\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: Need help checking whether a NEAR account ID exists or not? Use the fetch API available via BOS to make an RPC query call to get account information.\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip` List of all the current NEAR Stakers: https://near-staking.com\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: For more resources on Chain Signatures, check out this \\\\u{1f449} [linktree](https://linktr.ee/chainsignatures).\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: **New to NEAR? \\\\u{1f468}\\\\u{200d}\\\\u{1f4bb} :** Whether you\\\\\\'re familiar with Rust , JS, or simply eager to contribute to NEAR tooling, begin your journey with comprehensive NEAR docs and DevHub resources \\\\u{1f447}:\\\\n\\\\n1. NEAR docs: [Link](https://docs.near.org/)\\\\n2. DevHub: [Link](https://neardevhub.org/)\\\\n3. Engage with NEAR Tools \\\\u{1f449}[here](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=blog&id=2496)\\\\n4. Join the Community: Have questions? Join the lively discussions in [neardev](https://t.me/neardev) Telegram group.\\\\n5. Office Hours: Get personalized assistance during our [DevHub Office Hours](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=devrel&tab=office-hours).\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### RECENTLY UPDATED NEP\\\\\\'S \\\\u{2705}\\\\n\\\\n**APPROVED NEPs**: \\\\n\\\\nA successful NEP is one that addresses a specific problem or needs within the NEAR ecosystem. These are the NEPs that were approved by the protocol workgroup this week:\\\\n\\\\n- [NEP-519: Support for yielded execution](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/519) - Protocol Update | **8th March 2024**\\\\n- [NEP-491: Non-Refunable Storage](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/491) - Protocol Update | **26th Feb 2024**\\\\n  \\\\n\\\\n**REVIEW STAGE**:\\\\n\\\\nSubject matter experts are currently reviewing the following NEPs. Some of the working group members are also deciding whether to accept or reject them. Feel free to explore, these NEPs will aid you during your development as you integrate them with your dApps. Share your thoughts and leave a comment.\\\\n\\\\n- [NEP-330: Build details extension](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/533) - Contract standards Update \\\\n- [NEP-536: Reduce the number of refund receipts](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/536) - Protocol Update\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nTo learn more about NEP\\\\\\'s click \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0001.md) \\\\nTo view all the NEP\\\\\\'s click \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/orgs/near/projects/51/views/1)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### ETHDam \\\\u{1f3c6}\\\\n\\\\nDevHub, represented by Owen and Lyudmil, made a significant mark at ETH Denver. With a focus on two key tracks\\\\u{2014}**Chain Signatures** and **Power your startup with NEAR**\\\\u{2014}the team encouraged developers to build solutions, from multisig wallets to cross-chain voting systems and decentralized verification layers.\\\\n\\\\nThroughout the event, the DevRels provided round-the-clock support, ensuring developers had the guidance they needed to bring their ideas to life. A highlight was Owens talk on secure cross-chain transactions, which drew considerable interest.\\\\n\\\\nThe hackathon results were impressive, with 12 submissions in total and 7 of them implementing chain signatures. Among 382 registered hackers, winners included:\\\\n\\\\n- $1,500 for 2FA and Feedback \\\\n- $1,000 for Nevo\\\\n- $500 for Secured Jamon, JPEG Station, Octopus Layer and KudAs\\\\n\\\\n[2FA](https://taikai.network/cryptocanal/hackathons/ethdam2024/projects/cluz0xnnj013uz301nfa9uj4g/idea) - A two factor authentication multisig wallet that allows one to send tokens and mint NFTs on multiple networks. \\\\\\\"FA had a great UX, exciting implementation of chain signatures and proper use case.\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n![Sample Image](https://i.ibb.co/fd9911d/2fa.jpg)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n[Feedback](https://taikai.network/cryptocanal/hackathons/ethdam2024/projects/cluyuw0j200y3yz01yjjd4rap/idea) - A privacy preserving B2C survey platform that creates a NEAR account from a participants phone number used to derive an Ethereum Account and submit a cross chain private vote. Amazing integration with survey phone calls and blockchain, great potential.\\\\n\\\\n**Nevo** - Private cross chain voting with chain signatures and MACI. A very interesting use of chain signatures and good interaction between two different protocols.\\\\n\\\\n**Secured Jamon** - An atomic bridge-less cross-chain assets swap that has a good use of chain signatures and complex development flow to overcome.\\\\n\\\\n**JPEG Station** - Complex use of chain signatures to swap Bitcoin ordinals and Ethereum NFTs. JPEG Station has a great frontend and UX.\\\\n\\\\n**Octopus Layer** - A decentralized and censorship resistant verification layer for ZK snark proofs that settles in Near and distributes ZK proofs to all blockchains through chain signatures. Awesome use of ZK on NEAR.\\\\n\\\\n**KudAs** - Let\\\\\\'s you post and receive verifiable reviews on the blockchain. Boost reputations and watch the emerging social network of blockchain attestations! Great UI. \\\\n\\\\n\\\\nLooking ahead, winners have been invited to showcase their projects on the upcoming chain abstraction community call. Discussions during the call will revolve around utilizing the NEAR Multichain repository and addressing challenges encountered by developers during the hackathon.\\\\n\\\\n**DevHub** extends gratitude to **CryptoCanal** for hosting a successful event and congratulates all participants and winners. \\\\n[Link to NEAR DevHub Twitter](https://twitter.com/NEARDevHub) | [Link to ETH Denver website](https://www.ethdenver.com/)\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n![Sample Image](https://i.ibb.co/WcwGWgf/GLDX1b8-Wc-AAcb2f.jpg)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### QUOTE OF THE WEEK \\\\u{1f5e3}\\\\n\\\\n**Azure** [Hacker from ETHDam]: \\\\\\\" Owen and Lyudmil (DevHub DevRels)...I just had to drop a line to send a big THANK YOU your way for making the hackathon so amazing. You made my solo hacking way more enjoyable and recognizing 0x2FA as one of the winners along my friends. Seriously, you guys are rockstars! Ive made some awesome friendships and created some memorable memories with you guys.\\\\\\\"\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### CHAIN ABSTRACTION COMMUNITY \\\\u{1f929}\\\\n\\\\nThis April , the chain abstraction community has been actively engaged in discussions and developments aimed at enhancing interoperability and standardization across different blockchain networks.They have been exploring techniques like Multi-Party Computation (MPC) to address security and key management concerns. Discussions around key rotation within MPC systems have been gaining traction, as highlighted in recent community exchanges. As part of ongoing efforts to streamline development practices, there have been discussions on standardized deployment data storage practices, with community members advocating for transparent and accessible repositories of contract deployment information. \\\\n\\\\nCheck out this \\\\u{1f449} [GitHub repository](https://github.com/near/mpc-recovery) containing code for MPC contracts, illustrating the implementation of payload-based key management for chain signature requests and responses.\\\\n\\\\nFor further details, you can refer to the following links:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [Chain Signatures Documentation](https://docs.near.org/concepts/abstraction/chain-signatures)\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [NEAR Multichain Example](https://github.com/near-examples/near-multichain)\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [Chain Signatures Use Cases](https://docs.near.org/concepts/abstraction/signatures/use-cases)\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [FastAuth SDK Documentation](https://docs.near.org/tools/fastauth-sdk)\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [NEAR NFT Minting on Farcaster](https://warpcast.com/brower1/0xab61fd1b)\\\\n\\\\n[Learn more about the Chain Abstraction Community](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=chain-abstraction)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### CALL FOR CONTRIBUTORS \\\\u{1f4de}\\\\n\\\\n-  Notable takeaways from the ETHDam hackathon include the importance of clear examples for constructing chain signatures with data and navigating development flows for signing and sending transactions from contracts. You are welcome to contribute to documentation resolving this. Join the [documentation Community](https://t.me/neardocscg) for more.\\\\n\\\\n- NEAR Blocks is officially deployed on BOS. As a reminder, we are also open source - feel free to contribute \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://t.co/oaH82pEnQ3)\\\\n\\\\n- NEAR Horizon 2 Cohort invites developers like you to step into scaling decentralized applications. More details \\\\u{1f449}[here](https://twitter.com/nearhorizon/status/1768310840120189123).\\\\n\\\\n- Developers requested a demo/tutorial for testing substream setup for NEAR blockchain.\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n# UPCOMING EVENTS \\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### ONLINE:\\\\n- Chain Abstraction Community Call | Coming soon \\\\n- Thursdays 5PM UTC | **Join us on DevHub Livestreams Hosted by Joe** | [Live on X](https://twitter.com/NEARDevHub) and [Twitch](https://twitch.tv/neardevhub)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### Dubai, UAE:\\\\n\\\\n- April 22-23, 2024 | World Blockchain Summit | [Trescon](https://www.worldblockchainsummit.com/) | NEAR Foundation, tentative speaker slot (Arpit)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### USA:\\\\n\\\\n- May 29 - 31, 2024 | Consensus | [Coindesk](https://www.coindesk.com/events/consensus-2024) | NEAR Foundation\\\\n- April 29 - May 3, 2024 | [5th Annual International Tech Summit](https://www.internationaltechsummit.com/) | Hamilton, Bermuda | Penrose | \\\\\\\"Abhi V / Olga Chris D / Abhi speaking\\\\\\\"\\\\n\\\\n### EUROPE:\\\\n\\\\n- May 8-9, 2024 | Crypto and Digital Assets Summit \\\\n- May 21-23, 2024 | London Blockchain Conference \\\\n- May 24, 2024 | ETHBerlin | [DoD (dept. of decentralization)](https://ethberlin.com/) | DevHub, NEARWEEK\\\\n- May 27-30, 2024 | Blocksplit | [Eco Balkans Calimero](https://blocksplit.org/) | Eco\\\\n- May 29 - 31, 2024 | Blockchance 2024 | [Blockchance](https://www.blockchance.eu/) | Eco\\\\n- July 8-11, 2024 | ETHCC | Bettina/Jerome \\\\\\\"Ethereum France\\\\\\\" | NEAR Foundation (Summit + Sponsorship)\\\\n- July 11, 2024 | Pragma Brussels | [ETHGlobal](https://www.ethglobal.co/) | NEAR Foundation\\\\n- July 12 \\\\u{2013} 14, 2024 | ETHGlobal Brussels | [ETHGlobal](https://www.ethglobal.co/) | DevHub\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\nIf you are running a Local NEAR event please register as a Hackbox host [here](https://near.org/hackbox.near/widget/home). \\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n## CONSENSUS 2024\\\\nExciting opportunities await those interested in participating in the upcoming Consensus event. Choose from three ticket options tailored for the NEAR Ecosystem:\\\\n\\\\n- Hackathon Developer Pass: For active developers and open-source contributors committed to participating in-person at the EasyA Consensus Hackathon on May 29-31, A complimentary Developer Pass is offered to approved applicants until capacity is reached. Apply \\\\u{1f449}[here](https://consensus2024.coindesk.com/apply/developer-hackathon/-id/0).\\\\n\\\\n- Developer Pass: Special $109 rate available for active Web3 and Web2 developers. Apply before prices increase on March 15th [here](https://consensus2024.coindesk.com/apply/developer/-id/0). The Developer Pass grants access to all three days of Consensus on May 29-31.  \\\\n\\\\n- 15% off Pro Passes and Explorer Passes: Enjoy a 15% discount on Pro Passes and Explorer Passes using the code \\\\\\\"NEAR\\\\\\\" [here](https://consensus2024.coindesk.com/register?promo=NEAR).\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n## JOIN COMMUNITIES - TG CHANNELS \\\\n- [Protocol Community](https://t.me/NEAR_Protocol_Community_Group)\\\\n- [Stake-wars](https://t.me/near_stake_wars)\\\\n- [Tools Community](https://t.me/NEAR_Tools_Community_Group)\\\\n- [ZK Community](https://t.me/NearZeroKnowledge)\\\\n- [Documentation Community](https://t.me/neardocscg)\\\\n- [Wallet Builders](https://nearbuilders.com/tg-wallet)\\\\n- [Contracts Community](https://t.me/nearnft)\\\\n- [NEAR Devs](https://t.me/neardev)\\\\n- [Jutsu and BOS questions](https://t.me/tryjutsu/973)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n###### NEAR Dev NEWS is curated by the NEAR Dev NEWS group , and maintained by @victorkanu1.near & @orangejoe.near \\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n![Sample Image](https://i.ibb.co/MDJ5zZn/2024-04-03-16-10-19.jpg)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n##### Thanks for reading, See you Next Week!", "metadata": {"id": "3238", "title": "NEAR Dev NEWS #8", "author": "victorkanu1.near", "status": "DRAFT", "category": "news", "subtitle": "ETHDam ", "createdAt": "2024-04-18", "updatedAt": "2024-04-18", "description": "ETHDam ", "publishedAt": "2024-04-18", "communityAddonId": "blogv2"}}}}, "handle": "neardevnews"}

{"data": {"neardevnews.community.devhub.near": {"blog": {"near-dev-news-8-3238": {"": "Goedendag, Chain Abstractors! Welcome to NEAR Dev NEWS, your go-to destination for the freshest updates in the NEAR Developer ecosystem! NEAR lays the groundwork for all blockchain apps, offering an open-source system empowering devs to create fully decentralized, interoperable apps. In this edition, we bring you highly anticipated updates from ETHDam. Join us as we showcase the latest developer progress and technical advancements shaping the blockchain OS.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### FEATURED RELEASES & PR\\\\\\'s \\\\u{1f929}\\\\n\\\\n- `create-near-app` **Version** [6.4.0](https://github.com/near/create-near-app/releases/tag/v6.4.0) **has been released!**\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} Sandbox testing now follows the same language as the contract created\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} Removed vanilla frontend since very few people was using it\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} Frontend now creates FC key for hello.near-examples.testnet by default\\\\n\\\\n- `near-rust-sdk` **version 5.1.0 has been released**. The highlights of the release can be found \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/releases/tag/near-sdk-v5.1.0).\\\\n\\\\n- `nearcore` **Version 1.39.0 has been released** this week and function call base cost is reduced. For small transactions like on [Cosmose](https://twitter.com/Cosmose_) and [hotdao](https://twitter.com/hotdao_), it is a 2x reduction in cost and 2x in throughput. RPC is now faster! Learn more \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/nearcore/releases)\\\\n\\\\n- `near-api-js` **Version 4.0.0 has been released**. It contains:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} More than 36% bundle size reduction (from 380kb to 240kb). Info \\\\u{1f449}[here](https://bundlephobia.com/package/near-api-js@4.0.0)\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} Failover RPC configuration\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} Executing view functions without the need of a Connection object and more!\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} You can read more about the changes \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/near-api-js/pull/1318)!\\\\n\\\\n- `Wallet Selector` **Version 8.9.6 has been released**:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} Github --> https://github.com/near/wallet-selector/tree/v8.9.6\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} NPM --> https://www.npmjs.com/package/@near-wallet-selector/core\\\\n\\\\n- Discover more in releases and merged pull requests in our changelog \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://docs.near.org/changelog/2024/02/29/#-documentation).\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### DEVELOPER UPDATES \\\\u{1f6e0}\\\\n\\\\n- **Pagoda**: Pagoda has released [Access Keys indexer](https://near.org/dataplatform.near/widget/QueryApi.App?selectedIndexerPath=dataplatform.near/access_keys_v1) powered by QueryAPI that could be used as a drop-in replacement for KitWallet endpoint for access keys. This is yet another critical indexer powered by QueryAPI, built to showcase its reliability for critical applications. QueryAPI is currently in closed beta. You can request access [here](http://bit.ly/near-queryapi-beta) and read more in the [docs](https://docs.near.org/build/data-infrastructure/query-api/intro).\\\\n\\\\n- **Pagoda**: Has released the NFT Key Smart Contract. The MPC Account Recovery smart contract provides a sign method that accepts a path parameter. This allows one predecessor account to have access to an effectively unlimited number of MPC keys. The NFT Chain Keys contract takes advantage of this property and allows secure transfers of MPC keys between users, using the NEP-171 NFT contract standard. The contract also implements new functionality to enable chain key management features.\\\\n\\\\nDocs \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://docs.near.org/build/chain-abstraction/nft-chain-keys)\\\\n\\\\n- **Rust Version and Cargo Update**: Community members have shared insights on updating Rust versions and cargo dependencies for NEAR projects. Ensure that your `rust-toolchain.toml` file reflects the latest Rust version, and consider updating dependencies with `cargo update`. Additionally, the `cargo-near` tool has fixed issues with starting templates.\\\\n\\\\n- **Init Attribute Error**: Developers have encountered issues with the `#[init]` attribute in NEAR smart contracts. This error can be resolved by checking the Rust version, ensuring the correct usage of attributes, and using unique method names to avoid naming collisions. Refer to the [NEAR SDK documentation](https://docs.rs/near-sdk/latest/near_sdk/attr.near.html) for detailed information.\\\\n\\\\n- **Serialization and Structs**: Community members seek guidance on using custom structs in NEAR smart contracts. The NEAR DevHub contract repository provides valuable examples of defining and using structs. Explore the [NEAR DevHub repository](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-contract) for reference and best practices.\\\\n\\\\n- **Sharding Configuration**: Developers inquire about configuring sharding for NEAR networks. Understanding how account names determine shard allocation is crucial. Review the latest [shard splits](https://example.com/shard_splits) to ensure optimal deployment strategies.\\\\n\\\\n- **Local Testing and Gas Limit**: Developers look for ways to bypass the 300T gas limit in local integration testing with the NEAR sandbox. Consider using tools like `near-workspaces-rs` and exploring options for adjusting gas limits during local testing.\\\\n\\\\n- **Educational Content for NEAR Chain**: Community developers are actively working on educational content tailored to smart contracts created with the NEAR JavaScript SDK. A recent challenge focused on security issues targeted intermediate users. The challenge aimed to refine skills in handling transactions and ensuring security measures. You can try out the challenge [here](https://staging.agorapp.dev/ide/near/typescript/steal-the-tips/challenge).\\\\n\\\\n- **Documentation Updates**: Our documentation repository recently underwent a significant reorganization, involving over 250 URL changes. We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your patience. Broken links in the documentation have been addressed promptly. If you encounter any issues, please report them [here](https://docs.github.com/), and our team will swiftly resolve them. \\\\n\\\\n- **Promise handling**: Community developers engaged in technical discussions regarding promise handling and behavior in the NEAR JavaScript SDK. Issues such as orphaned promises and transaction atomicity were explored, aiming to align behaviors with other SDKs and ensure consistency.\\\\n\\\\n- **Addressing Signature Verification Challenges.**: The developer community addressed challenges related to signature verification within the wallet selector framework. A member sought assistance in signing and verifying arbitrary messages using the wallet selector, encountering hurdles, especially with signatures obtained from the Wallet.signMessage method. Insights were shared, highlighting compatibility issues with ed25519 signatures and providing resources for reference. These resources include examples from NEP-413, such as the [NEP Example reference](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/98), a [Wallet Selector react example](https://github.com/nearprotocol/wallet-selector), and the [Wallet Selector helper functions repository](https://github.com/nearprotocol/wallet-selector). The community expressed appreciation for the shared resources and expressed intentions to further explore them. \\\\n\\\\n- **NF Update**: NEAR Foundation Launches Infrastructure Committee with $4 Million in Funding. Learn more \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://pages.near.org/blog/near-launches-infrastructure-committee/)\\\\n\\\\n- **DevHub Feature**: All announcements and discussions from DevHub communities in one place!\\\\nClick \\\\u{1f449}[here](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=announcements)\\\\n\\\\n- **Fast NEAR**: Introduces FREE RPC endpoint for NEAR Protocol mainnet. Feel free to use it at [https://free.rpc.fastnear.com](https://t.co/3DVVZmaSFt)\\\\n\\\\n- **MultiSig on NEAR**: Seeking documentation about MultiSig on NEAR. Check out the MultiSig contract repository \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/core-contracts/tree/master/multisig).\\\\n\\\\n- **Protocol WG**: The Protocol Work Group prepares to vote on NEP-536, a proposal to optimize NEAR protocol\\\\\\'s performance. NEP-536 focuses on reducing the number of refund receipts, a significant contributor to runtime overhead. Don\\\\\\'t miss this opportunity to contribute to the discussion \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/536).\\\\n\\\\n- **signMessage issue**: Developers provided an update on the signMessage issue and shared the latest developments on [GitHub](https://github.com/near/near-wallet/issues/3135).\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### THIS WEEKS TIPS \\\\u{1f4a1}\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: A request was made to report broken links. The suggestion was to open an issue on the docs GitHub or make a PR with the proper link. The relevant link for documentation issues is \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://docs.github.com/).\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: You can re-create a transaction in [near.cli.rs](https://github.com/near/near-cli-rs), edit it and send again with ease. Using interactive mode of near CLI, select \\\\\\\"transaction\\\\\\\" -> \\\\\\\"reconstruct-transaction\\\\\\\". You will get a new CLI command constructed for you to edit and run.\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: Need to top-up USDT to a NEAR wallet on the test network? Use a faucet. [Faucet Link](https://near-faucet.io/).\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: Need help checking whether a NEAR account ID exists or not? Use the fetch API available via BOS to make an RPC query call to get account information.\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip` List of all the current NEAR Stakers: https://near-staking.com\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: For more resources on Chain Signatures, check out this \\\\u{1f449} [linktree](https://linktr.ee/chainsignatures).\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: **New to NEAR? \\\\u{1f468}\\\\u{200d}\\\\u{1f4bb} :** Whether you\\\\\\'re familiar with Rust , JS, or simply eager to contribute to NEAR tooling, begin your journey with comprehensive NEAR docs and DevHub resources \\\\u{1f447}:\\\\n\\\\n1. NEAR docs: [Link](https://docs.near.org/)\\\\n2. DevHub: [Link](https://neardevhub.org/)\\\\n3. Engage with NEAR Tools \\\\u{1f449}[here](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=blog&id=2496)\\\\n4. Join the Community: Have questions? Join the lively discussions in [neardev](https://t.me/neardev) Telegram group.\\\\n5. Office Hours: Get personalized assistance during our [DevHub Office Hours](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=devrel&tab=office-hours).\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### RECENTLY UPDATED NEP\\\\\\'S \\\\u{2705}\\\\n\\\\n**APPROVED NEPs**: \\\\n\\\\nA successful NEP is one that addresses a specific problem or needs within the NEAR ecosystem. These are the NEPs that were approved by the protocol workgroup this week:\\\\n\\\\n- [NEP-519: Support for yielded execution](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/519) - Protocol Update | **8th March 2024**\\\\n- [NEP-491: Non-Refunable Storage](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/491) - Protocol Update | **26th Feb 2024**\\\\n  \\\\n\\\\n**REVIEW STAGE**:\\\\n\\\\nSubject matter experts are currently reviewing the following NEPs. Some of the working group members are also deciding whether to accept or reject them. Feel free to explore, these NEPs will aid you during your development as you integrate them with your dApps. Share your thoughts and leave a comment.\\\\n\\\\n- [NEP-330: Build details extension](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/533) - Contract standards Update \\\\n- [NEP-536: Reduce the number of refund receipts](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/536) - Protocol Update\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nTo learn more about NEP\\\\\\'s click \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0001.md) \\\\nTo view all the NEP\\\\\\'s click \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/orgs/near/projects/51/views/1)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### ETHDam \\\\u{1f3c6}\\\\n\\\\nDevHub, represented by Owen and Lyudmil, made a significant mark at ETH Denver. With a focus on two key tracks\\\\u{2014}**Chain Signatures** and **Power your startup with NEAR**\\\\u{2014}the team encouraged developers to build solutions, from multisig wallets to cross-chain voting systems and decentralized verification layers.\\\\n\\\\nThroughout the event, the DevRels provided round-the-clock support, ensuring developers had the guidance they needed to bring their ideas to life. A highlight was Owens talk on secure cross-chain transactions, which drew considerable interest.\\\\n\\\\nThe hackathon results were impressive, with 12 submissions in total and 7 of them implementing chain signatures. Among 382 registered hackers, winners included:\\\\n\\\\n- $1,500 for 2FA and Feedback \\\\n- $1,000 for Nevo\\\\n- $500 for Secured Jamon, JPEG Station, Octopus Layer and KudAs\\\\n\\\\n[2FA](https://taikai.network/cryptocanal/hackathons/ethdam2024/projects/cluz0xnnj013uz301nfa9uj4g/idea) - A two factor authentication multisig wallet that allows one to send tokens and mint NFTs on multiple networks. \\\\\\\"FA had a great UX, exciting implementation of chain signatures and proper use case.\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n![Sample Image](https://i.ibb.co/fd9911d/2fa.jpg)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n[Feedback](https://taikai.network/cryptocanal/hackathons/ethdam2024/projects/cluyuw0j200y3yz01yjjd4rap/idea) - A privacy preserving B2C survey platform that creates a NEAR account from a participants phone number used to derive an Ethereum Account and submit a cross chain private vote. Amazing integration with survey phone calls and blockchain, great potential.\\\\n\\\\n**Nevo** - Private cross chain voting with chain signatures and MACI. A very interesting use of chain signatures and good interaction between two different protocols.\\\\n\\\\n**Secured Jamon** - An atomic bridge-less cross-chain assets swap that has a good use of chain signatures and complex development flow to overcome.\\\\n\\\\n**JPEG Station** - Complex use of chain signatures to swap Bitcoin ordinals and Ethereum NFTs. JPEG Station has a great frontend and UX.\\\\n\\\\n**Octopus Layer** - A decentralized and censorship resistant verification layer for ZK snark proofs that settles in Near and distributes ZK proofs to all blockchains through chain signatures. Awesome use of ZK on NEAR.\\\\n\\\\n**KudAs** - Let\\\\\\'s you post and receive verifiable reviews on the blockchain. Boost reputations and watch the emerging social network of blockchain attestations! Great UI. \\\\n\\\\n\\\\nLooking ahead, winners have been invited to showcase their projects on the upcoming chain abstraction community call. Discussions during the call will revolve around utilizing the NEAR Multichain repository and addressing challenges encountered by developers during the hackathon.\\\\n\\\\n**DevHub** extends gratitude to **CryptoCanal** for hosting a successful event and congratulates all participants and winners. \\\\n[Link to NEAR DevHub Twitter](https://twitter.com/NEARDevHub) | [Link to ETH Denver website](https://www.ethdenver.com/)\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n![Sample Image](https://i.ibb.co/WcwGWgf/GLDX1b8-Wc-AAcb2f.jpg)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### QUOTE OF THE WEEK \\\\u{1f5e3}\\\\n\\\\n**Azure** [Hacker from ETHDam]: \\\\\\\" Owen and Lyudmil (DevHub DevRels)...I just had to drop a line to send a big THANK YOU your way for making the hackathon so amazing. You made my solo hacking way more enjoyable and recognizing 0x2FA as one of the winners along my friends. Seriously, you guys are rockstars! Ive made some awesome friendships and created some memorable memories with you guys.\\\\\\\"\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### CHAIN ABSTRACTION COMMUNITY \\\\u{1f929}\\\\n\\\\nThis April , the chain abstraction community has been actively engaged in discussions and developments aimed at enhancing interoperability and standardization across different blockchain networks.They have been exploring techniques like Multi-Party Computation (MPC) to address security and key management concerns. Discussions around key rotation within MPC systems have been gaining traction, as highlighted in recent community exchanges. As part of ongoing efforts to streamline development practices, there have been discussions on standardized deployment data storage practices, with community members advocating for transparent and accessible repositories of contract deployment information. \\\\n\\\\nCheck out this \\\\u{1f449} [GitHub repository](https://github.com/near/mpc-recovery) containing code for MPC contracts, illustrating the implementation of payload-based key management for chain signature requests and responses.\\\\n\\\\nFor further details, you can refer to the following links:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [Chain Signatures Documentation](https://docs.near.org/concepts/abstraction/chain-signatures)\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [NEAR Multichain Example](https://github.com/near-examples/near-multichain)\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [Chain Signatures Use Cases](https://docs.near.org/concepts/abstraction/signatures/use-cases)\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [FastAuth SDK Documentation](https://docs.near.org/tools/fastauth-sdk)\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [NEAR NFT Minting on Farcaster](https://warpcast.com/brower1/0xab61fd1b)\\\\n\\\\n[Learn more about the Chain Abstraction Community](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=chain-abstraction)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### CALL FOR CONTRIBUTORS \\\\u{1f4de}\\\\n\\\\n-  Notable takeaways from the ETHDam hackathon include the importance of clear examples for constructing chain signatures with data and navigating development flows for signing and sending transactions from contracts. You are welcome to contribute to documentation resolving this. Join the [documentation Community](https://t.me/neardocscg) for more.\\\\n\\\\n- NEAR Blocks is officially deployed on BOS. As a reminder, we are also open source - feel free to contribute \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://t.co/oaH82pEnQ3)\\\\n\\\\n- NEAR Horizon 2 Cohort invites developers like you to step into scaling decentralized applications. More details \\\\u{1f449}[here](https://twitter.com/nearhorizon/status/1768310840120189123).\\\\n\\\\n- Developers requested a demo/tutorial for testing substream setup for NEAR blockchain.\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n# UPCOMING EVENTS \\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### ONLINE:\\\\n- Chain Abstraction Community Call | Coming soon \\\\n- Thursdays 5PM UTC | **Join us on DevHub Livestreams Hosted by Joe** | [Live on X](https://twitter.com/NEARDevHub) and [Twitch](https://twitch.tv/neardevhub)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### Dubai, UAE:\\\\n\\\\n- April 22-23, 2024 | World Blockchain Summit | [Trescon](https://www.worldblockchainsummit.com/) | NEAR Foundation, tentative speaker slot (Arpit)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### USA:\\\\n\\\\n- May 29 - 31, 2024 | Consensus | [Coindesk](https://www.coindesk.com/events/consensus-2024) | NEAR Foundation\\\\n- April 29 - May 3, 2024 | [5th Annual International Tech Summit](https://www.internationaltechsummit.com/) | Hamilton, Bermuda | Penrose | \\\\\\\"Abhi V / Olga Chris D / Abhi speaking\\\\\\\"\\\\n\\\\n### EUROPE:\\\\n\\\\n- May 8-9, 2024 | Crypto and Digital Assets Summit \\\\n- May 21-23, 2024 | London Blockchain Conference \\\\n- May 24, 2024 | ETHBerlin | [DoD (dept. of decentralization)](https://ethberlin.com/) | DevHub, NEARWEEK\\\\n- May 27-30, 2024 | Blocksplit | [Eco Balkans Calimero](https://blocksplit.org/) | Eco\\\\n- May 29 - 31, 2024 | Blockchance 2024 | [Blockchance](https://www.blockchance.eu/) | Eco\\\\n- July 8-11, 2024 | ETHCC | Bettina/Jerome \\\\\\\"Ethereum France\\\\\\\" | NEAR Foundation (Summit + Sponsorship)\\\\n- July 11, 2024 | Pragma Brussels | [ETHGlobal](https://www.ethglobal.co/) | NEAR Foundation\\\\n- July 12 \\\\u{2013} 14, 2024 | ETHGlobal Brussels | [ETHGlobal](https://www.ethglobal.co/) | DevHub\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\nIf you are running a Local NEAR event please register as a Hackbox host [here](https://near.org/hackbox.near/widget/home). \\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n## CONSENSUS 2024\\\\nExciting opportunities await those interested in participating in the upcoming Consensus event. Choose from three ticket options tailored for the NEAR Ecosystem:\\\\n\\\\n- Hackathon Developer Pass: For active developers and open-source contributors committed to participating in-person at the EasyA Consensus Hackathon on May 29-31, A complimentary Developer Pass is offered to approved applicants until capacity is reached. Apply \\\\u{1f449}[here](https://consensus2024.coindesk.com/apply/developer-hackathon/-id/0).\\\\n\\\\n- Developer Pass: Special $109 rate available for active Web3 and Web2 developers. Apply before prices increase on March 15th [here](https://consensus2024.coindesk.com/apply/developer/-id/0). The Developer Pass grants access to all three days of Consensus on May 29-31.  \\\\n\\\\n- 15% off Pro Passes and Explorer Passes: Enjoy a 15% discount on Pro Passes and Explorer Passes using the code \\\\\\\"NEAR\\\\\\\" [here](https://consensus2024.coindesk.com/register?promo=NEAR).\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n## JOIN COMMUNITIES - TG CHANNELS \\\\n- [Protocol Community](https://t.me/NEAR_Protocol_Community_Group)\\\\n- [Stake-wars](https://t.me/near_stake_wars)\\\\n- [Tools Community](https://t.me/NEAR_Tools_Community_Group)\\\\n- [ZK Community](https://t.me/NearZeroKnowledge)\\\\n- [Documentation Community](https://t.me/neardocscg)\\\\n- [Wallet Builders](https://nearbuilders.com/tg-wallet)\\\\n- [Contracts Community](https://t.me/nearnft)\\\\n- [NEAR Devs](https://t.me/neardev)\\\\n- [Jutsu and BOS questions](https://t.me/tryjutsu/973)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n###### NEAR Dev NEWS is curated by the NEAR Dev NEWS group , and maintained by @victorkanu1.near & @orangejoe.near \\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n![Sample Image](https://i.ibb.co/MDJ5zZn/2024-04-03-16-10-19.jpg)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n##### Thanks for reading, See you Next Week!", "metadata": {"id": "3238", "title": "NEAR Dev NEWS #8", "author": "victorkanu1.near", "status": "DRAFT", "category": "news", "subtitle": "ETHDam ", "createdAt": "2024-04-18", "updatedAt": "2024-04-18", "description": "ETHDam ", "publishedAt": "2024-04-18", "communityAddonId": "blogv2"}}}}}}

{"data": {"blog": {"near-dev-news-5-3240": {"": "\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nWelcome to NEAR Dev NEWS, your prime source for the latest in the NEAR Developer ecosystem! NEAR lays the groundwork for all blockchain apps, offering an open-source system empowering devs to create fully decentralized, interoperable apps. Our Digest showcases developer progress and technical updates shaping the blockchain OS.\\\\n\\\\nBefore we kick into updates for the new week, please take the time to fill it out our survey and play a pivotal role in shaping the ecosystem. Your feedback will provide valuable info to builders and contributors, paving the way for FRPs (Request for proposals) on DevHub. \\\\n\\\\n###### [CLICK HERE TO FILL SURVEY \\\\u{1f3c6}](https://bit.ly/devhub-survey-q1-2024)\\\\n\\\\nThank you for participating, now let\\\\u{2019}s get into the updates!\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### FEATURED RELEASES & PR\\\\\\'s \\\\u{1f929}\\\\n\\\\n- `nearcore`: Version 1.38.0 has been released . This contains a protocol upgrade. learn more \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/nearcore/releases/tag/1.38.0)\\\\n\\\\n- `VM` [Released version 2.6.0](https://github.com/NearSocial/VM/releases/tag/2.6.0): VM execution layer for decentralized frontend components.\\\\n\\\\n- `near-sdk-rs` [Released version near-sdk-v5.0.0](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/releases/tag/near-sdk-v5.0.0): Rust SDK for writing smart contracts.\\\\n\\\\n- `near-cli-rs`: 0.8.0 -> 0.8.1 (\\\\u{2713} API compatible changes). To update `near` CLI use: near extensions `self-update`\\\\n\\\\n- Discover more in releases and merged pull requests in our changelog \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://docs.near.org/changelog/2024/02/29/#-documentation).\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### DEVELOPER UPDATES \\\\u{1f6e0}\\\\n\\\\n- Next release of `near-api-js` will include the ability to select transaction finality. Release expected in the next couple of days.\\\\n\\\\n- Developers are exploring the implementation of a broadcast_tx_async-based wallet to enhance user experience within the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\n- `New Documentation`: Discover how your NEAR account can control accounts on other chains, such as Ethereum, through Chain Signatures. Learn more in our new articles:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\u{1f449}[What are Chain Signatures?](https://docs.near.org/concepts/abstraction/chain-signatures)\\\\n\\\\u{1f449}[Create a Chain Signature](https://docs.near.org/abstraction/chain-signatures)\\\\n\\\\n- Chain Abstraction, What is it? Learn about it \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://twitter.com/NEARDevHub/status/1772615619168403619).\\\\n\\\\n- Learn about Chain Abstractions goals \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://twitter.com/ilblackdragon/status/1770890267018535308).\\\\n\\\\n- Community members compare gas costs between contracts compiled from JavaScript SDK and contracts compiled from Rust to WASM, revealing significant differences in gas consumption.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} Rust based WASM: [Transaction Link](https://testnet.nearblocks.io/txns/J8MiLqghiWxRWhogsZSRVYYaJx4WRbAKcUuM1xMDu5fJ#)\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} JS based WASM: [Transaction Link](https://testnet.nearblocks.io/txns/25MufUqsgeuQAJ9EZXKdSgrjuCmMHHFyMtNKx1i9Fe9q#)\\\\n\\\\nReason: Rust\\\\\\'s strong typing and memory safety features can lead to more robust and secure contracts, but they also introduce additional overhead in terms of gas costs due to the need for stricter memory management and error handling mechanisms. \\\\n\\\\n- Check out this deep dive into [Lava Network](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V-16v_h0s5s). To stay updated on cutting edge tech, be sure to check out the rest of our [whiteboard series](https://www.youtube.com/@NEARProtocol/search?query=whiteboard)!\\\\n\\\\n- We received positive feedback on community tools\\\\\\' functionality and smooth operation. Efte, a member of our tools community shares thoughts: \\\\\\\"Yea I am pretty happy with tooling by now, Everything works smooth and I like it a lot.\\\\nWould be happy to work together with somebody to create FT, NFT and / or cross contract call walkthroughs and youtube videos even\\\\\\\".\\\\n\\\\n- There\\\\\\'s been discussions on the possibility of re-deploying contracts from JavaScript to Rust while preserving state. It\\\\\\'s possible, but you will need to make sure that your Rust version can read the serialized data stored in the state. You can use `near.cli.rs` to view your contract storage to make that decision: `near contract view-storage`. \\\\n\\\\n- **DevHub** announces a significant upgrade to DevHub that revolutionizes the funding journey. Detailed information about the revamped proposal submission and funding process aligned with DevDAO\\\\\\'s mission can be found \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=blog&id=3251).\\\\n\\\\n- Discussion on renaming `near-cli-rs` to reduce confusion in the ecosystem, suggesting `inear` (Interactive NEAR) as an alternative.\\\\n\\\\n- Confirmation that contracts can be annotated using either the verbose 5.0.0 way or the concise 5.1+ way, providing flexibility and backward compatibility.\\\\n\\\\n- Consideration of handling annotations in documentation, particularly the transition from `#[near_bindgen]` to `#[near]`, is discussed because there\\\\\\'s a shift in the SDK\\\\\\'s approach to contract annotations. With the release of SDK 5.1+, the #[near] annotation is introduced as a more concise alternative to #[near_bindgen]. This transition is significant for developers as it affects how they annotate their contracts and interact with the NEAR ecosystem. \\\\n\\\\nBy adopting #[near], developers can reduce the boilerplate code and make their contracts more concise, enhancing readability and maintainability. There\\\\\\'s also a discussion on the importance of handling contract annotations in the documentation.\\\\n\\\\n-  Interest expressed in FastAuth, an authentication mechanism for NEAR Protocol, aimed at simplifying onboarding and account recovery. You can find more information about FastAuth here: \\\\n\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [NEAR Wiki](https://wiki.near.org/overview/BOS/fast-auth) \\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [NEAR blog](https://pages.near.org/blog/fastauth-sdk-beta-now-available/)\\\\n\\\\nIt\\\\\\'s also mentioned that FastAuth should work on testnet, and while there might not be extensive example implementations readily available, contributions to improve documentation and examples are welcome. [Documentation Community](https://t.me/neardocscg)\\\\n\\\\n- Users encounter errors while attempting to create accounts on NEAR testnet. The issue appears to stem from account creation scripts lacking necessary private key configurations. Community members provide troubleshooting advice and code snippets to resolve the issue. [Link to discussions](https://t.me/neardev/41846)\\\\n\\\\n- A recent change in the NEAR RPC API caused disruptions for some applications, prompting concerns about backward compatibility and proper deprecation warnings. However, the change has since been reverted to address the issue and ensure continuity for developers relying on the NEAR RPC API. \\\\n\\\\n- Stay updated with the NEAR Validator upgrade: [NEAR Validator Update](https://pages.near.org/blog/an-update-on-the-near-validator-upgrade/?ssp=1&setlang=en&cc=AT&safesearch=moderate).\\\\n\\\\n-  Ecosystem Developers explore methods for updating contract metadata and ensuring changes propagate to indexers. [Join Tools Community](https://t.me/NEAR_Tools_Community_Group)\\\\n\\\\n- Community members discuss NEAR Protocol contract addresses and share pull requests for fixing issues in NEAR Lake Indexer. [Join Near dev community](https://t.me/neardev)\\\\n\\\\n- Join us as we celebrate the activation of six shards on NEAR Protocol!\\\\n\\\\n- Explore `near-api-js` updates and signing messages guidance in the [near-api-js Cookbook](https://github.com/near/near-api-js/blob/master/packages/cookbook/utils/verify-signature.js).\\\\n\\\\n- In the next release of `near-api-js`, you will be able to choose the finality of the transaction using the new `send_tx` method. This release will be live in the next couple of days. See the changes [here](https://github.com/near/nearcore/blob/447572bb775a5954ca7a5a4b65c85b45aab9e499/chain/jsonrpc/CHANGELOG.md#023).\\\\n\\\\n- A participant shared their website, which won a prize in the NEAR Hacks hackathon. https://nearvisionai.streamlit.app/.  more can be found on the results page https://nearhacks.hackerearth.com/. \\\\n\\\\n- Ongoing development on a new API wrapper aimed at reducing boilerplate code.\\\\n\\\\n- We had discussions on integrating BOS\\\\\\'s Social API into a Node.js project with suggestions for creating a wrapper using naxios.\\\\nCheck out \\\\u{1f449}[Naxios Repository](https://github.com/wpdas/naxios). \\\\n\\\\n- An issue was raised regarding refunding users for storage usage in a contract, where the function returned the same value at the start and end. Suggestions were provided to force changes to storage by calling `.flush()` on the collections if using `near_sdk::store` collections.\\\\n\\\\n- A user discussed an issue with `near-sdk-js` where a JS error occurred during build, potentially related to contract state initialization. Suggestions included trying to deploy to a fresh account and avoiding inheritance with `@NearBindgen`. Check out \\\\u{1f449} [NEAR SDK JS repo](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-js). \\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### THIS WEEKS TIPS \\\\u{1f4a1}\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: For more resources on Chain Signatures, check out this \\\\u{1f449} [linktree](https://linktr.ee/chainsignatures).\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: Engage with the  [Documentation Community](https://t.me/neardocscg) for updates, clarifications, and alignment with actual usage and best practices.\\\\n\\\\n- `Tip`: If you run a TESTNET validator node, please update it to the [1.38 version](https://github.com/near/nearcore/releases/tag/1.38.0-rc.2). Office Hours: Get personalized assistance during our [DevHub Office Hours](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=devrel&tab=office-hours).\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### RECENTLY UPDATED NEP\\\\\\'S \\\\u{2705}\\\\n\\\\n**APPROVED NEPs**: \\\\n\\\\nA successful NEP is one that addresses a specific problem or needs within the NEAR ecosystem. These are the NEPs that were approved by the protocol workgroup this week:\\\\n\\\\n- [NEP-519: Support for yielded execution](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/519) - Protocol Update | **8th March 2024**\\\\n- [NEP-491: Non-Refunable Storage](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/491) - Protocol Update | **26th Feb 2024**\\\\n  \\\\n\\\\n**REVIEW STAGE**:\\\\n\\\\nSubject matter experts are currently reviewing the following NEPs. Some of the working group members are also deciding whether to accept or reject them. Feel free to explore, these NEPs will aid you during your development as you integrate them with your dApps. Share your thoughts and leave a comment.\\\\n\\\\n- [NEP-330: Build details extension](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/533) - Contract standards Update | **5th March 2024**\\\\n- [NEP-393: Add class metadata interface](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/528) - Contract Standards Update | **26th Feb 2024**\\\\n- [NEP-483: Prefix Tag for signed messages](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/483) - Protocol Update | **26th Feb 2024**\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nTo learn more about NEP\\\\\\'s click \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0001.md) \\\\nTo view all the NEP\\\\\\'s click \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/orgs/near/projects/51/views/1)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### HACKS OF THE WEEK \\\\u{1f468}\\\\u{200d}\\\\u{1f4bb}\\\\u{1f3c6}\\\\n\\\\n- NameSky creates an improved repo detailing how to clear a large contract state (needed when deleting accounts with large contracts) Check it out on [Github](https://github.com/nameskyteam/state-cleanup).\\\\n\\\\n- Announcement of [Lantstool](https://lantstool.io/), a web application facilitating RPC interaction through a user-friendly interface.\\\\nPlanned features include transaction management, shared spaces, and on-chain data storage, with an anticipated release in 1-2 months.\\\\n\\\\n**Building something on NEAR?** Share your project with the community! Tell us about it in the documentation community group, and get featured. Click \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://t.me/neardocscg).\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### CHINA DEVRELS \\\\u{1f929}\\\\n\\\\n- The Chinese Developer Office Hour every Friday has been updated with a [new invitation link](https://meeting.tencent.com/dm/a3xBOJfGHDYH)\\\\n- Chinese dev community has been actively discussing Chain Signatures throughout the month of march. Robert Yan will present a workshop _Chain Signature In Action_ on Mar 27th.\\\\n- [The 3rd cohort of Rust course](https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/aqo8vn6YAUc6MvGXv0503Q) partnered with Rust CC and Tintin Land has started and will finish in May. \\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### STAKEWARS \\\\u{1f680}\\\\n**Participating in Stakewars? Here are some quick news and notes you should be aware of.**\\\\n\\\\n- Due to popular demand, the Stake Wars IV period has been extended until the end of April. For updated reward criteria and more details, please refer to the \\\\u{1f449}[rewards documentation](https://github.com/near/stakewars-iv/blob/main/REWARDS.md).\\\\n\\\\n- We\\\\\\'re pleased to announce that state sync issues have been fixed! No binary update is required. Simply change back `state_sync_enabled:` true and restart your node. For detailed instructions, refer to \\\\u{1f449} [this guide](https://github.com/near/stakewars-iv/blob/main/HOW_TO.md).\\\\n\\\\n- It\\\\\\'s essential to update your nodes to the latest version. Find the instructions for node update \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/stakewars-iv/blob/main/HOW_TO.md#node-update).\\\\n\\\\n- Users can submit bug reports for rewards \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/stakewars-iv/blob/main/REWARDS.md#2-bug-bounty).\\\\n\\\\n- We\\\\\\'re currently investigating chunk validation errors reported by some nodes. Rest assured, this won\\\\\\'t affect rewards until the issue is resolved. Stay tuned for updates!\\\\n\\\\n- Join the excitement of the second round of Wheel of Transactions at [Learn NEAR Club](https://learnnear.club/wheel-of-transactions-second-round/)!\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### CHAIN ABSTRACTION COMMUNITY\\\\u{1f929}\\\\n\\\\nComprising of hackathon participants and developers, the chain abstraction community has been engaged in discussions exploring various aspects of the technology and its potential applications. Participants exchanged ideas on projects such as account aggregation, cross-chain token arbitrage bots, multichain DEXs, lending platforms, and NFT marketplaces across multiple blockchains.\\\\n\\\\nTechnical discussions cover topics like deriving foreign addresses, integrating with Ethereum Layer 2 solutions, and utilizing MPC contracts for transaction signing. Members are exploring the development of multichain applications, utilizing chain signatures to enable seamless interoperability across various blockchain networks.\\\\n\\\\nDevelopers have also provided valuable feedback on the usability and functionality of tools and SDKs related to chain abstraction, highlighting areas for improvement such as, enhanced SDK typings, and standardized CLI commands.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nFor further details, you can refer to the following links:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [Chain Signatures Documentation](https://docs.near.org/concepts/abstraction/chain-signatures)\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [NEAR Multichain Example](https://github.com/near-examples/near-multichain)\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [Chain Signatures Use Cases](https://docs.near.org/concepts/abstraction/signatures/use-cases)\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [FastAuth SDK Documentation](https://docs.near.org/tools/fastauth-sdk)\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [NEAR NFT Minting on Farcaster](https://warpcast.com/brower1/0xab61fd1b)\\\\n\\\\n[Learn more about the Chain Abstraction Community](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=chain-abstraction)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### CALL FOR CONTRIBUTORS \\\\u{1f4de}\\\\n\\\\n-  Ecosystem developers propose a devcontainer image for examples encompassing both Rust and Node tooling. Volunteers are welcomed to contribute to `near-devcontainers` and test the additional container on examples. [Join Tools Community](https://t.me/NEAR_Tools_Community_Group)\\\\n\\\\n- We\\\\\\'ve initiated alpha testing the BOS web engine for creating decentralized front end components on NEAR. Get involved today by following this [link](https://bwe-docs.near.dev/).\\\\n\\\\n- NEAR Horizon 2 Cohort invites developers like you to step into scaling decentralized applications. Matias is working on documentation updates, but additional assistance may be required. Don\\\\\\'t hesitate to reach out if you can lend a hand! Reach out to [Docs community](https://t.me/neardocscg).\\\\n\\\\n- Given the release of the new SDK, both docs and example repositories need updating. If you want to contribute , [join the Docs Community Group](https://near.social/devgovgigs.near/widget/gigs-board.pages.community.activity?handle=documentation).\\\\n\\\\n- Join the StatelessNet Traffic Generation Reward Program. {"data": {"neardevnews.community.devhub.near": {"blog": {"near-dev-news-5-3240": {"": "\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nWelcome to NEAR Dev NEWS, your prime source for the latest in the NEAR Developer ecosystem! NEAR lays the groundwork for all blockchain apps, offering an open-source system empowering devs to create fully decentralized, interoperable apps. Our Digest showcases developer progress and technical updates shaping the blockchain OS.\\\\n\\\\nBefore we kick into updates for the new week, please take the time to fill it out our survey and play a pivotal role in shaping the ecosystem. Your feedback will provide valuable info to builders and contributors, paving the way for FRPs (Request for proposals) on DevHub. \\\\n\\\\n###### [CLICK HERE TO FILL SURVEY \\\\u{1f3c6}](https://bit.ly/devhub-survey-q1-2024)\\\\n\\\\nThank you for participating, now let\\\\u{2019}s get into the updates!\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### FEATURED RELEASES & PR\\\\\\'s \\\\u{1f929}\\\\n\\\\n- `nearcore`: Version 1.38.0 has been released . This contains a protocol upgrade. learn more \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://github.com/near/nearcore/releases/tag/1.38.0)\\\\n\\\\n- `VM` [Released version 2.6.0](https://github.com/NearSocial/VM/releases/tag/2.6.0): VM execution layer for decentralized frontend components.\\\\n\\\\n- `near-sdk-rs` [Released version near-sdk-v5.0.0](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/releases/tag/near-sdk-v5.0.0): Rust SDK for writing smart contracts.\\\\n\\\\n- `near-cli-rs`: 0.8.0 -> 0.8.1 (\\\\u{2713} API compatible changes). To update `near` CLI use: near extensions `self-update`\\\\n\\\\n- Discover more in releases and merged pull requests in our changelog \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://docs.near.org/changelog/2024/02/29/#-documentation).\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n### DEVELOPER UPDATES \\\\u{1f6e0}\\\\n\\\\n- Next release of `near-api-js` will include the ability to select transaction finality. Release expected in the next couple of days.\\\\n\\\\n- Developers are exploring the implementation of a broadcast_tx_async-based wallet to enhance user experience within the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\n- `New Documentation`: Discover how your NEAR account can control accounts on other chains, such as Ethereum, through Chain Signatures. Learn more in our new articles:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\u{1f449}[What are Chain Signatures?](https://docs.near.org/concepts/abstraction/chain-signatures)\\\\n\\\\u{1f449}[Create a Chain Signature](https://docs.near.org/abstraction/chain-signatures)\\\\n\\\\n- Chain Abstraction, What is it? Learn about it \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://twitter.com/NEARDevHub/status/1772615619168403619).\\\\n\\\\n- Learn about Chain Abstractions goals \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://twitter.com/ilblackdragon/status/1770890267018535308).\\\\n\\\\n- Community members compare gas costs between contracts compiled from JavaScript SDK and contracts compiled from Rust to WASM, revealing significant differences in gas consumption.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} Rust based WASM: [Transaction Link](https://testnet.nearblocks.io/txns/J8MiLqghiWxRWhogsZSRVYYaJx4WRbAKcUuM1xMDu5fJ#)\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} JS based WASM: [Transaction Link](https://testnet.nearblocks.io/txns/25MufUqsgeuQAJ9EZXKdSgrjuCmMHHFyMtNKx1i9Fe9q#)\\\\n\\\\nReason: Rust\\\\\\'s strong typing and memory safety features can lead to more robust and secure contracts, but they also introduce additional overhead in terms of gas costs due to the need for stricter memory management and error handling mechanisms. \\\\n\\\\n- Check out this deep dive into [Lava Network](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V-16v_h0s5s). To stay updated on cutting edge tech, be sure to check out the rest of our [whiteboard series](https://www.youtube.com/@NEARProtocol/search?query=whiteboard)!\\\\n\\\\n- We received positive feedback on community tools\\\\\\' functionality and smooth operation. Efte, a member of our tools community shares thoughts: \\\\\\\"Yea I am pretty happy with tooling by now, Everything works smooth and I like it a lot.\\\\nWould be happy to work together with somebody to create FT, NFT and / or cross contract call walkthroughs and youtube videos even\\\\\\\".\\\\n\\\\n- There\\\\\\'s been discussions on the possibility of re-deploying contracts from JavaScript to Rust while preserving state. It\\\\\\'s possible, but you will need to make sure that your Rust version can read the serialized data stored in the state. You can use `near.cli.rs` to view your contract storage to make that decision: `near contract view-storage`. \\\\n\\\\n- **DevHub** announces a significant upgrade to DevHub that revolutionizes the funding journey. Detailed information about the revamped proposal submission and funding process aligned with DevDAO\\\\\\'s mission can be found \\\\u{1f449} [here](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=blog&id=3251).\\\\n\\\\n- Discussion on renaming `near-cli-rs` to reduce confusion in the ecosystem, suggesting `inear` (Interactive NEAR) as an alternative.\\\\n\\\\n- Confirmation that contracts can be annotated using either the verbose 5.0.0 way or the concise 5.1+ way, providing flexibility and backward compatibility.\\\\n\\\\n- Consideration of handling annotations in documentation, particularly the transition from `#[near_bindgen]` to `#[near]`, is discussed because there\\\\\\'s a shift in the SDK\\\\\\'s approach to contract annotations. With the release of SDK 5.1+, the #[near] annotation is introduced as a more concise alternative to #[near_bindgen]. This transition is significant for developers as it affects how they annotate their contracts and interact with the NEAR ecosystem. \\\\n\\\\nBy adopting #[near], developers can reduce the boilerplate code and make their contracts more concise, enhancing readability and maintainability. There\\\\\\'s also a discussion on the importance of handling contract annotations in the documentation.\\\\n\\\\n-  Interest expressed in FastAuth, an authentication mechanism for NEAR Protocol, aimed at simplifying onboarding and account recovery. You can find more information about FastAuth here: \\\\n\\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [NEAR Wiki](https://wiki.near.org/overview/BOS/fast-auth) \\\\n\\\\u{1f449} [NEAR blog](https://pages.near.org/blog/fastauth-sdk-beta-now-available/)\\\\n\\\\nIt\\\\\\'s also mentioned that FastAuth should work on testnet, and while there might not be extensive example implementations readily available, contributions to improve documentation and examples are welcome.
